Reviews.Title: “Nice stay...”
Reviews.Author: Smiley_111
Reviews.Content: Nice spacious room and we requested for a 3rd bed to be put in the room, this is what we found on arrival. Everything was clean. Bathroom was clean and of average size. Breakfast was included for us and we found this was quite varied and pleasant. Reception staff were quite helpful when we needed help printing off our boarding passes in the small computer room. Location of the hotel was ok, about 10mins in a taxi from Clarke Quay. (lovely place to eat...) - not far from the nearest train station too! It's a 2min taxi ride from Tiong Bahru station. Overall a nice stay for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: RohanM69
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel after a long trip and was dissapointed with the food and the service at the hotel. I tried out the dinner buffet and the food served on most dishes was cold. Must mention here that I visited the restaurant at 10pm when the closing time was 10.30pm. After the dissapointing dinner i hoped that the breakfast would be better however before starting the breakfast my hopes were shattered on encoutering the two ladies at the desk Monica and Clarissa. They were mostly rude and laughed at all the guests including myself. They appeared to consider all guests as fools and kept giggling most of the time. I wonder if the management trains the staff to be rude to its guests and if not to please look into the matter

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Manolinton
Reviews.Content: I usually stayed in the EUR 160-180 range hotels, but this time I was tired of paying that much (compared to what it used to be a couple of years ago) and I took the Singapore Stopover offer for Furama Riverfront at around EUR 90, even though reviews in this forum were not that great. The hotel perfectly suited my needs (business travel). It is not so centrally located, but in Singapore everything is 5-10 minutes away by taxi, so no big deal. The room was a bit outdated but it had all the essentials (internet also). Checkin a bit crowded since there were many tourists at that time, but at these prices that is also expected. Breakfast (buffet) not included in price, but they charged a very reasonable price for it. Extrememely helpful and professional concierge (Sri was his name); On my last day in the hotel I forgot an item in a taxi and he managed to track the taxi and send the item back to me after I left the hotel. Will I return to this hotel? Definetly yes, as long as they keep this price versus the more "premium" hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Our Easter Holiday”
Reviews.Author: PutuY
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in city... the staff very helpful to give us the information and everything... Many thanks for San Fung (Reception) and Zeihnda (F&B Service)....thank you for your help and information. The location is near from Orchard Road and China town, for get the MRT just walk around 10 minutes from hotel. The Hotel is circle of chinese restaurant, 7 Elevant mini mart, ... and everything you need. Once again if come to Singapore, come to Furama RiverFront.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: viveksingh25
Reviews.Content: Hotel Furama RiverFrony was a nice place where my company put me up when I had to do a 5-Day course in Singapore. Pick up was arranged by the Hotel, though the drop wasn't. The hotel is app 30mins from the airport. Location is quite nice. Its walking distance (about 15mins) from China Town / Clark Quay. The hotel has shuttle to Clark Quay as well as Orchard Street, details of which can be found out from the reception / conceirge. The staff was quite helpful though its better to ask everything from them as items such as laundry, airport drop, lunch etc might not be included with your package. I was staying on the 14th floor. Room was great. Wifi/Lan cable were there for internet, which was included in the package booked for me by my company. The restaurant was great for all meals. Overall, great place to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Expensive but a very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sreenivasbidari
Reviews.Content: i stayed there for 6 days on a business trip. The hotel is has excellent rooms and the service quality is also very good. The swimming pool and the Health club is also very good. the location is very convenient as it is very close to CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and service”
Reviews.Author: Jfeil
Reviews.Content: Stayed while attending an international exposition at Changi Airport. The hotel is a bit off the beaten path, but the price makes it a good bet. The rooms are very large and loved the shower !! Very modern styling, Had a few issues with service at the restaurant. They are better equipped for the buffet and ordering from the menu is a challenge. To be fair, I did inform them of my problems with their service and they were able to make it up to me and were sincere. Definitely would stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Make it your choice”
Reviews.Author: calonge78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid March taking advantage of Singapore Airlines super "stop over" accommodation offer. Having been to Singapore before, location, value for money and a good hotel was important and the Furama River Front was all of these things. Unusually for this city the hotel has better than average size bedrooms and the higher up one goes so does the price. The buffet breakfast is worth a mention but as everything in Singapore it comes at a price! The reception and front of house teams were excellent. The location is within walking distance of China town, the Quays and the "hop on hop off" bus stop is within 2 minute walk away. There are plenty of restaurants on the opposite side of the river to the hotel but be warned they can be quite expensive, on the other hand try DA Dong located in China town and sample his special "Peking Duck" I've had plenty but this come out tops. This hotel for location and service gets my recommendation

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: flashjack92
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel within the last 12 months. This time we shared our room with our adult daughter. The room was spacious, very clean, and well presented. Nothing is a bother to the staff that work there. From the doorman to the cleaners they are beautiful people. This time we managed to utilize the swimming pool. The buffet breakfast which was included in our holiday was just amazing. They have discovered an even balance between Asian and Western. I defy anyone to complain about the food. The same goes for the evening meals. They do have a courtesy bus to take you into Orchard Rd and this is only a ten minute drive. Alternatively you can catch a taxi for a very small monetary amount. We highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: PegususPerth
Reviews.Content: We got a very good rate at this Hotel for a club room and decided it was worth staying there. We had also read that they had recieved some awards for being the best mid range Hotel. For a four star hotel it did not disappoint us at all, in fact, it was very good and it would be hard to find a hotel in this range that is better. The location was not good but we made the best of it and managed to find our way around and it gave us a chance of exploring a different area of Singapore. There are plenty of buses that are very close to the Hotel and we caught the SAEX from the nearby Miramar Hotel to the Zoo. Our room was modern but small and the bed was very hard. The staff were great in finding us a bed topper for the mattress which helped. They were also willing to move us to another room with better views but as it was a bit of messing around we stayed where we were first located. The club lounge is set up differently to what we normally experiance and was on the second floor. The setting made it very pleasant for a change. We found the club lounge to be excellant and felt spoilt. The evening snacks couldn't have been better. The variety and quality was amazing, so much so that we deliberately did not go there on one of ours nights so as not to spoil our dinner. There were four hot dishes, a wide selection of sushi with all the trimmings, two desserts and a selection of three different very small dishes as well as a few good quality cheeses. For drinks they offered the usual, including a choice of two beers and even teh tarak. Breakfast was good and pretty much standard, there was plenty to choose from and they had different asian selections each day. The only thing lacking was honey but on asking the staff they were fantastic in getting some for us from their kitchen. There is an adjoining nightclub (if that is in fact what it is called) with plenty of pretty young girls coming in and out of it and frequented by elderly men. We had a look at it but felt unwelcome and were advised that they just had small private rooms for karioke. I have to say, there must be a lot of young ladies and old men in Singapore that sing well.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lzl25
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and clean however I feel the hotel was very outdated. Also, the location is quite far away so a taxi or shuttle is needed. However, for those looking for value for money I hink this hotel is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “An old hotel with comfortable room, swimming pool, but away from main tourist areas in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Humouresque
Reviews.Content: An old hotel with comfortable average size rooms. Busy front desk, Internet is charged at S$5 per half hour at Internet room. Away from central Singapore so you need a taxi to get to most places (about 8 minutes to Marina Bay Sands). Meals at hotel restaurant is ok. Staff are polite.

Reviews.Title: “Might Be Ok ???”
Reviews.Author: RadSul
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with family for short trip vacation. The staff is okay,...for breakfast prefer to go outside,...room was clean but might be okay,..for us its just an average hotel..and remember the location is NOT near from MRT and riverwalk

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Xian09
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Furama which was part of a Singapore vacation. The hotel is a little dark inside but nice. The bar area has a nice view to sit in and visit . Breakfast was included and was very good. For the price the hotel is nice and I really have no complaints. Would I stay again if I were choosing my hotel and it wasn't part of a package-probably not.

Reviews.Title: “hotel in need of a refurb.”
Reviews.Author: nzsue_10
Reviews.Content: Brochure made rooms look wonderful but we were very disappointed when we got there. Room was very very basic and small and in desperate need of a refurb. Coffee was complimentary daily - a whole one sachet each a day WOW!! We booked a double room and had a double and a single bed in the room?????? At least with it being a room for 3 we got an extra sachet of coffee and bottle of water daily whoopee doo!! Staff are wonderful though and breakfast was great. If you go here make sure you book the executive floors as the rest of the hotel rooms are too basic and shabby looking.

Reviews.Title: “Exorbitant and slow internet, tired decor”
Reviews.Author: missskybird
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Furama for five nights on our way home to Sydney from Hong Kong. Our first impression was of a very grand hotel with imposing lobby and foyer, huge bar/lounge area with a feature waterfall outside, visually pleasing and elegant. As a stop-over holiday with Singapore Airlines our room was a standard one. I asked if we could pay for an upgrade and was told they would not know what to charge me (?) as they did not know what the agent had charged. The gentleman said he would give us a complimentary upgrade, which was nice of him although I think it just made life easier for him! I asked about Internet access and was asked did I have a laptop. I advised them that on this trip I had just brought my iPad, "too bad, laptop access is much cheaper then Wi-Fi", excellent! The most you could book at a time was 60 minutes at a cost of $15 Singapore dollars-daylight robbery these days when the majority of hotels are offering free broadband and Wi-Fi internet. I was told they did have an internet room that I could use. However it operated on Wi-Fi so the cost was the same $15 per 60 minute block. The internet was extremely slow and barely worth using except for basic email. We then headed to our 'Superior' Room on the 10th Floor. The first impression when leaving the lift on the tenth floor was a stale, musty smell that was very evident in the corridor. The walls of the corridor were gouged with pieces out of them and poorly repaired .The bottom of the front door to our room was broken and the veneer lifted. The room was ok, thankfully it had a nice view of a small park opposite although you did have to peer through the filthy windows. The room also looked tired. There were crayon lines on the wall obviously from a previous guest’s child. The power points were discoloured and old. The bathroom was a reasonable size with a shower over the bath. The downside was the mould that was at the bottom of the soap tray, the corner of the walls and below the taps. There is no excuse; this is simply poor housekeeping practice. The towels were thin and worn and quite rough.The bed was extremely hard and the pillows likewise. Our room had an adjoining door which meant that noise from guests in the room next door carried through into our room. On several nights we were woken in the early hours of the morning by guests talking loudly in the corridor and banging doors. There was a bar fridge and the hotel did provide two complimentary bottles of water daily which was very handy when you are sightseeing in the humidity. The coffee provided was horrible as was the powdered milk. Have they not heard of long life milk? On the up side of our stay was the Waterfall Lounge and dining at the Four Square Restaurant. From 3pm to 8pm every day is Happy Hour in the Waterfall Lounge, which with the lovely waterfall outside the massive glass windows is a very pleasant way to spend an evening. Each night there was entertainment by a local singer and musician. They were fantastic and the range and variety of music was wonderful. The staff in the lounge are very friendly and attentive. We had opted to include the daily buffet breakfast in our package so each morning we ate in the Square @ Furama. A modern pleasant restaurant with helpful and friendly staff the breakfast was great value. Providing both Asian and Western food options you would be hard pressed not to come away feeling very satisfied. The Singapore Airlines Hop-On-Hop-Off Bus stop is two doors down from the hotel outside the Miramar Hotel which is quite close and convenient. Overall I would only rate the Furama Riverfront as average. It is advertised as the business class hotel on Havelock Road, however that is not my impression. I guess if the little things do not matter you will be happy at the Furama.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: gidgetsurf
Reviews.Content: check in with ease. lovely rooms with amazing bathroom. room was clean and roomy. everything was to our satisfaction. we were in an excutive room which entitled us to free drinks and canapes at night which was enough for our dinner. Eror (think thats how her name is spelt) and micheal were fantasic, could not have been any more helpful and informative. loved them. suprised Eror has never been team member of the month, maybe that could be changed as she derserves it. had breakfast each morning in the main resturant. staff were good and helpful here except for today, our last day, 14th feb. dishes were not cleared from our table, so by the time we were finished, we had a table full of dirt dishes. we were never offered coffee. bad service. the hotel is also a fait way from most attractions, which is a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, Clean, Good location, Corteous Service.”
Reviews.Author: Julierb67
Reviews.Content: A very good option if you are staying short or long periods of time in this fabulous city. Service is very friendly, rooms are spacious and comfortable, clean, fair price, excellent breakfast. Check out was a bit slow and showed a few mistakes in the bill, but everything was sorted in a nice way.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: squishy_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is is fairly close to clarke quay for dining options and walkable to Orchard road (taxi is quicker and only about S$6 though so a better option in the heat. The rooms are a decent size and well equipped, they're looking a little old now but still maintained well and clean. The pool and sauna area is nice - but don't use the laundry - it was S$16 for a wash and dry!

Reviews.Title: “A 4 minus hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ken B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Furama Riverfront for 2 nights for a Business meeting. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. Several shops are also located in the hotel if you need to pick up something. Room was smaller than I was expecting for the room rate although it was clean and well maintained. The furniture didn't fit very well in the small room causing some mobility problems getting up in the night. The room had a very large flat screen TV but limited channels to view, water pot and instant coffee and tea, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, hotel safe in the closet, and the usual tooth brush, shampoo etc in the bath. Alas, had towels but no wash cloths. Good thing I brought one. Also has a locked minibar which I did not have opened. The WIFI was free but seems to be very slow and the internet worked best using the Broadband cable provided. The desk said the WIFI was free until Feb 6th, so if you check in after that date, may have to pay. I didn't see the river, so don't expect the hotel to be on the "Riverfront". They have a nice buffet breakfast but it seems to be the same every day. So, what you had yesterday, expect the same today. To me, the hotel is a low 4 star hotel. Not a bad place to stay, but when I go back to Singapore, will prefer to try some place different. ps. Drinks in the bar are expensive, At least I thought 16 Singapore dollars for a local beer was expensive - but maybe I don't drink much at hotel bars.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant check-staff, unbelievably bad attitude.”
Reviews.Author: kieraVictoria
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for four people ie a family room with Mum, Dad, two boys aged 14 and 11 years. Normally this hotel doesn't do family rooms however we organised through Singapore airlines that they would put an extra bed in a triple room so we could all be together. We have done this all over Europe, has never been a problem. So we turn up very jetlagged, for us it is the middle of the night but Singapore time it is 7am. They say no sorry we only have three single beds in the room. We never put an extra bed, this is our hotel and this never happens. They didn't care that we booked for four people and their explanation was that the boys would be sharing a single bed. This was the most bizarre excuse imaginable. Anyway we were exhausted but rang Singapore airlines who spent the day trying to convince the hotel to put another bed in the room and by evening they found someone sypathetic who said yes ok. Up until that point they would not budge. I found the reception staff deceitful, they kept changing their story and their attitude to customer service was appalling. Never stay here. Singapore airlines stopover staff however were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: jayelle8
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. The superior rooms was just average. Breakfast at the hotel really needs to improve in taste and variation. Hotel staff were polite. But the fact that wifi was only restricted to the lobby area for 30mins was frustrating. There was LAN cable for free internet in the individual rooms but really, even backpacker hotels provide free wifi without limited time frame.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Blossom7777777
Reviews.Content: From the airport I caught a taxi, costing $27 to get to the hotel. Checking in was good. I arrived at 6am and the young man on reception allowed me to check in half hour after the cleaning staff arrived at 7am. He directed me to their lounge area, which was quiet and comfy while I waited. Room was neat and tidy, nice big flat screen tv. In the bathroom there was no shower gel, they used soap or bath foam, conditioner shampoo (in one) and a moisturizer cream, toothbrush and paste and shower cap. There is a KTV and nightclub right next to the hotel, didn't check it out, but you would hardly even know it's there (it's not noisy). Their information desk staff were helpful in arranging tours - I enjoyed the Duck Tour, an on land, and on water (like a duck) tour of the city. There is a free shuttle service from the hotel to Orchard Road and Chinatown and back at certain times. The concierge staff were also very friendly making each morning a pleasant one. Breakfast was very good. Overall it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: famwood
Reviews.Content: Just had another great stay.We were with friends who were celebrating their wedding anniversary.Advised the hotel of this before arrival and they had flowers and fruit basket in the room for them on arrival.The guest relations manager had picked a room for them with a view of the Singapore flyer.These are the things that will keep us choosing this property when we visit Singapore.Recommend people choose breakfast to be included in the rate at booking.Great value in a great location for walking along the riverfront and all of the attractions of Clarke & Boat Quay.Free bus into Orchard road area.We went to see Wicked at Marina Bay Sands Complex and it was not an expensive taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “I run down Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashish B
Reviews.Content: The Furama River Front is a big let down. Locationally good but the rest leaves a lot to be desired. The carpet in the room stinks and is stained, the windows are old and rusted, the walls have seepage, the buttons on the TV remote are missing, the housekeeping is poor. The wires from the telephone were broken, the in room menu card was in pieces. The hotel lobby looks ancient. The staff is less then courteous. The concierge is the worst, a few men sitting around each other gossiping. We asked for a change of room and were told that for that we need to pay extra. We didnt think it even worth the amount we paid. Not recommended at all.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Excellence at virtually every level”
Reviews.Author: Thompson P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Furama RIverFront for four days in January 2012. While there I hosted a no-frills seminar for work for which I needed next to nothing in the way of accommodations. The room was clean and the bed was terrific. The wireless internet was a little pathetic, but it was included with the cost of the room, which is merciful compared to similar hotels in the US. I only have two issues with the room itself. First, the hardwood floor of the meeting room was badly scratched. Second, the walls were bare. There's an antiseptic quality to a large room with bare walls that was apparent after just a few minutes sitting in the room. For the expense, it seems like it wouldn't be too great a hardship to put perfunctory prints on the wall. The Furama RiverFront's location is excellent. It sits minutes away from a bunch of Singapore hot spots. If you're taking MRT, you're going to be disappointed though. The cab rides from the Furama are typically short, but they are more or less mandatory. It's not that the walks to any given point of interest are far, per se, nor the walk to the nearest MRT station. It's just that you have to brave a lot of traffic and walk in a very roundabout way. I never had to wait long for a cab-- usually no time at all-- but it's something you probably should know ahead of time. One thing I'd like to highlight is the service here. The quality of customer service in Asia is better than what I find in the USA generally, but the Furama stood out among the places I've stayed. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful when addressing my very few needs, whether I was addressing parking issues for one my seminar attendees or walking in the front door at 4am. I greatly enjoyed my stay at the Furama RiverFront, and I expect I'll stay again when I return to Singapore later this year.

Reviews.Title: “A really good mid-range business hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: GB01
Reviews.Content: There are two Furama Hotels in Singapore (City Centre and RiverFront) and several others across Asia. There is quite a mix of hotels in this area of the City State, mostly built in the 1980’s. Furama RiverFront is in easy walking distance to the rather touristy Singapore River but doesn’t actually front on to it! The hotel is somewhat outside the city centre although in truth nowhere is that far in Singapore! The taxi fare from Changi airport is around S$25 (Jan 2012). The nearest MRT is a bit of a walk but a courtesy coach runs to and from these hotels to Orchard Road, a world famous shopping area voted just this year as the ‘Best Shopping Street in the World! I think for me the most enjoyable aspect of this hotel is the 10 minute walk in the evening along the beautifully lit river to the many bars and restaurants at Robertson Quay and a little further on at Clarke Quay and then on to Boat Quay. I can certainly recommend the small Italian pizzeria, Da Mario at Robertson Quay although I was disappointed by the rather poor steak and soggy frites at Les Bouchons Rive Gauche a little further along. I stayed in the Tropical Wing. The bedrooms have both been a good size with extremely comfortable supersize beds - the width of a football field - covered in pristine white linen (the beds that is, not the pitches!). The rooms are, in my experience, clean, quiet and very dark having solid wood shutters, not curtains. This is preferable particularly when you are adjusting to a new time zone. Oddly, there is no BBC World on the TV but no matter because when I’m in Singapore I prefer to watch Channel News Asia. The in-house Wi-Fi is not free but it’s fast and I had no connection issues. The buffet style breakfast is truly excellent with a wide choice of Western and Asian food. The major plus for me is great tasting coffee with the beans ground at the serving point. This is obviously an airline hotel with a lot of crews coming and going. There is also a good ‘7 to 11’ type convenience shop at the petrol garage adjacent to the next-door Miramar Hotel. This was my second stay in this hotel on business and this being Singapore; the thing one notices is the super-efficient level of service from the staff: especially from the front desk, housekeepers and door people. In my opinion, this is a really good business hotel and has been awarded ‘Best Mid-Range Hotel Asia Pacific’ for the past three years which surely must tell you something.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth G
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, close to Clarke Quay but a bit further from the city, however, taxi fares to and fro were very cheap and taxis are always on standby. The buffet breakfast is fabulous. Rooms are quite spacious and the beds very comfortable. The only negative was the Waterfall Lounge where the service was poor and the food ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accommodation/Price/Service”
Reviews.Author: Penny C
Reviews.Content: Great hotel as not around the 'hub' of other hotels, a lovely quiet location. 10 minute walk to & from Clarke Quay & a free countesty bus up to Orchard Rd. & Chinatown. No. 123 bus just around corner to drop you off near hotel - 1 minute walk. Hotel had good service, lovely welcoming staff, terrific buffet breakfast & lovely room, always a pleasure to stay at the Furama Riverfront when we travel here from Oz.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Singapore - but you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Rick_Johnson
Reviews.Content: Big, busy hotel. Lots of coach parties and flight crews. With that in mind, it's appealing to a certain demographic. This is another hotel that I've stayed in on a few occasions over the years. Twice for business, once on a personal trip. Generally speaking, I find the rooms quite large. The beds have always been good in the rooms that I've stayed in. The facilities are ok to good. WiFi's expensive though. It does need a refurbishment though. A lot of the hotel and rooms are showing their age, in my experience. But, for the money a room costs here, compared to elsewhere in Singapore, you're not going to go too wrong. There's not much around this hotel location wise. Jump in a taxi - problem solved. However, you can follow the river down to the quays from here. It's around a 15 to 20 minute walk to Boat Quay, with some bars and restaurants on the way. So, would I go back again? Probably not, but it depends how much money's in my wallet...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but!”
Reviews.Author: maryhillmagyar
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to stay at, but would not 'overly' recommend the location, If returning I would stay close to Clarke Quay for evening entertainment and food.

Reviews.Title: “Super Double King!”
Reviews.Author: japanagogo
Reviews.Content: I loved, loved, loved the bed. I even slept sideways on it (for a nap). Have to pay for Wifi, so that is no good. I seriously don't understand why a hotel of this caliber would charge for Wifi. Service, much? The hotel is near the Robertson Quay area, so there were many great places to eat. Needed a taxi to go to and from. The staff I dealt with were incredibly hospitable, which eased my check-in process greatly. Nice enough view of part of the city. I would stay here again, if not only for the bed!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jeevnav
Reviews.Content: Booked an executive room with Furama to celebrate my anniversary. First, the executive room is beautiful for a couple. Be sure to request for one with a tub. The bed is massive and extremely comfortable. The view could be better but the executive floor looks awesome.However, the shower temperatures are rather erratic...it was always either too hot or too cold. Next, the executive lounge is a really nice spot to unwind for people staying in executive room. You get free soft drinks/fruit juice all day and free cocktails in the evening with a small buffet. The service staff are also very very friendly. The check in and check out was really smooth, and the staff once again were really attentive to all our needs. The location is close to one of singapore's more famous nightclubs (zouk). However, it is a little difficult to get to if you are not taking a cab. On the whole, It was an extremely good stay and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor and slow service, but better after complaining”
Reviews.Author: Bolus01
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the SIA-stop-over, so the accommodation was paid beforehand. At check-in I was asked to charge my CC for S$400 or make a deposit of €200. They said it was to cover the minibar charges. I forgot my CC and thought it was absurt to make such a large deposit... My BF complained as well and (because we never use minibar) asked them to lock the minibar. After giving us a strange glare the frontdesk lady (forgot her name but she was super snobby) phoned a collegue to lock the minibar and proceeded our check-in. She told us she gave us a upgraded room free of charge. We went to our room (nr. 1232), opend the door and were very disapointed... The room was small with a queensize bed. The bathroom was dated with the shower/bathtub with showercurtain. If this was een upgrade I can't imagine how standard rooms looks like... It almost seemed like they just tell you you get an upgrade so you feel special but in fact you just get a standard room. But this wasn't the worst part... The bathroom smelled like mold and there were small flee-like insects jumping around... My BF killed most of them, and since we were meeting some friends in town, we didn't want to go back to the frontdesk. When we came back at night the room still smelled like mold, but we didn't want to complain and thought it might be our imagination. Next day we went to our parents room (also sleeping in this hotel) to "smell" their room. It was now clear it wasn't just us. So we decided to complain at frontdesk. This time we were assisted by a lovely young lady who felt really awful when we told her our room conditions. She immediatly gave us a real upgrate to a CLEAN large room with a kingsize bed and bathroom with seperate shower and bathtub (nr. 1517). The day after we also received a fruitbasket as apologies, which was a sweet gesture. But there were a few other incidents which resulted in my rating as "poor" for this hotel. We decided to eat at their restaurant The Square one evening with our SIA-voucher (50%off). The voucher was only applicable on their a la carte selection and The Square was mainly a buffet restaurant. We were still accepted and were able to order 2 dishes. I odered laksa and my BF hamburger and fries. Many dishes came out if the kitchen but they were all for the buffet... After we waited half an hour the waitress gave us some fruits from the buffet so we could eat something... After 15 more minutes my BF got irritated and asked the manager where our food was. Directly after complaining the (fake friendly) manager came with his hamburger and fries. His meal was cold, apparently they wanted to serve both mine and his dish simultaneously... He asked the manager if they could reheat it and she told him they would make a new order. After this my laksa arrived and now he had to wait... Finally his meal was ready, but the fries were not newly prepared (as they said) but fried for a second time...they were full of oil because of that.... The only thing the manager offered us as compensation was to select one dish of the buffet... That was such a weak offer so we passed.... Another incident was the last evening at their Waterfall Lounge. A friend of ours wanted a small snack, so we ordered potato wedges (with homemade tartar sauce and tomato sauce). It took 30 min for them to prepare them! And the waitress only served the potato without the sauces. When we told her she said she could serve us some chili sause. We asked her to bring us the sauces that were suposed to be served with the potato according their menu. She eventually went to the kitchen and arrived 10 min later with the correct sauces. By now we already finished half of the potato's... All in all, I won't be staying in this hotel again and I won't recomment it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with a good breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: LOLA_BLISS
Reviews.Content: Furama Riverfront is worth the stay. Singapore is known for expensive accommodation. However, Furama Riverfront provide reasonable room rate but its room is in tip-top condition. The room is very clean and spacious. I must praise the hotel for providing good breakfast buffet. The MRT station is not within walking distance but taxis can be found easily. Just queue at the hotel entrance, the taxis will drive in.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: steveerose9
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a night, they have nightly entertainment, lots of bars nice pools.. nice rooms pretty average and standard. the only downfall is the windows.. they seriously need to clean them you can't tell what kind of day it is. other than that beds comfy minibar real expensive so don't use it if you can

Reviews.Title: “Expected bigger room.”
Reviews.Author: korndamned
Reviews.Content: For the rate charged. I was expecting something better. Everything is just slightly below my expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: SpikeAfrica
Reviews.Content: I expected more from this hotel after reading the reviews on this site. But that was not to be. THis hotel sees a lot of "airline" traffic' a lot of flight crews stay in this place. The hotel itself needs a good refurbishment. We stayed on the 6th floor, the passages were dirty, carpets and walls were marked and needed a good touche up and paint. Rooms were very very average, more like 3 star not 4. They were ok size, but stark and very "somber and almost Travel lodge type of rooms. Bathrooms, well the toilet ran all night, the shower clogged and the toilet leaked all the time, so the floor was wet and smelt of damp. For two mornings we had not hot water at all. The whole hotel was out of hot water....... Not what I expected. the pool is right outside the conference centre, everyone has a good look while walking past. Breakfasts were good and good value, about the only thing worth while. The bar was always half empty and two tired looking singers tried their level best to entain the patrons until 1am. Not that central either, a good taxi ride away from most places. we were on business for ten days.

Reviews.Title: “Central and well equipped, but watch out for wifi issues”
Reviews.Author: FluffyViv78
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a great hotel for business. Centrally located, clean and well equipped rooms (good showers), great facilities (the gym was small but well equipped, the pool blissfully empty at 7am), and the bar is well suited to informal business meetings. Quality of the food was also great, but the attentiveness of the staff at the buffet could have been improved. Still, good value and great selection. Beware the $20 beer (i'd advise going to the bar in happy hour only) but even here the prices weren't higher than in other similar establishments in Singapore. What let the hotel down for me were the exorbitant wifi prices and issues with connectivity, which for a business hotel is a central requirement. When you're connected, it works well, but due to a room mix up on the first night, I had to pay again, despite having paid for seven days' access (your wifi account is linked to your room, not your device or a log in). Reception did remove the charge, but it took some negotiation. During the course of the week I heard numerous other people having a similar problem and I would urge them to look at the wifi provision. Wifi for a week is $140. Secondly, if you're checking out early for a meeting, but flying out late and intending to work in the bar, be aware that no matter when your room related wifi is due to expire (you can use wireless in communal spaces), it will be shut off after you check out. At this point, the only option is to buy extra time from reception, but the maximum time allowed is an hour at a cost of $15. A good hotel and I would recommend for business travellers, but there was a lack of attention to detail which made it a little frustrating when dealing with jetlag and back to back meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: xmroots
Reviews.Content: I only had one night in Singapore city on this occasion and the Furama suited me fine. The ultra-modern hotel rooms might be a little cold and clinical for some but after my previous Singapore stay of a few weeks ago this was a breath of fresh air. Room service food was excellent and delivered promptly. I will certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: chnnang
Reviews.Content: i stayed here in may 2010 with my wife and daughter for 5 nights. the hotel has every thing you might need for good stay. the rooms are large and well furnished and kept very clean. breakfast is a delight each day, excellent choice of foods and drinks. the location is good it's not city centre but you can get to most places for under $10 in a taxi and the room rates are less than orchard road. it's only a 15 minute stroll to clarke quay's restaurants and bars if you don't want to ride. we found the staff to be very helpful and friendly, the two older doormen seem to be able to point you in the direction of anything you might want to buy or visit in singapore. very nice holiday and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. don't beleive the name though, it's not on the riverfront there's a six lane highway and another hotel between you and the river.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: Growler50
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here in August and it was very good value. Staff were particularly friendly and it proved a good location for the city centre - just a 10-15 min walk - and there was always a taxi waiting if you didn't fancy pegging it.Singapore was safe to walk around in at any time - its almost crime free.Hot buffet breakfast was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Functional”
Reviews.Author: KChandra
Reviews.Content: Four of us - My brother and his wife + my wife and self had been on a holiday at Singapore and stayed at this hotel. Located in a very nice locality, we found the hotel very hospitable and functional. Advance reservation made the check in process very easy. The staff were very courteous and eastern hospitality meant that someone led us to the room and the luggage followed. Room was spacious and comfortable. We stayed for 3 days and the housekeeping staff did a very good job. All facilities in the room functioned nicely and there was no room for complaint. The breakfast spread was OK and I must make a special mention of the packed breakfast we were given when we left at 4.30 AM on the last day! Though the location was very good, we had to travel some distance to get into the shopping area. Since we are vegetarians, we travelled to the Indian part of Singapore to taste some original south indian food. Taxis were freely available and we made the most of our stay. Singapore itself provides fantastic oppotunities for a tourist and this hotel added to our enjoyable holiday. We will have no hesitation in recommending this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “There are much better choices in Singapore for less money”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: I’ve spent 2 weeks at the Furama Riverside on a business trip. I will not stay there again when I return next month. The lobby has been made to look pretty but the guest rooms are old and in need of a full refurbishment. The first room I had (Executive Room) was old and tired. The carpet was badly worn down at the entrance and the walls were poorly patched. Many of the front desk staff came across as huffy and arrogant. There seemed to be little flexibility and consideration for business traveler needs. The maids are friendly but don’t speak English (mainland Chinese) The buffet supper is pretty good in terms of variety, but the food is only so-so in quality. Location is decent (10min walk to Robertson Quay). The fitness facilities are poor. The pool is average.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: beolsson
Reviews.Content: Staying almost a week in the same hotel is always a risk. However, the location is almost perfect since it is not in the middle of the buzz but still within waking distance to most central attractions. Take the walk down the river and you are in the very center within the time it takes to get a taxi or catching the bus. Some may wish to be closer to a MTR station (Outram park) but there are busses that takes you there just outside the hotel. The Hotel by itself turned out to be quite good even though I had a bad start. I was booked in an executive room which is great because breakfast is included as well as access to the executive lounge that serves drinks an light meal for free between 6 to 8 pm. However, the room I fist got on 17th floor was very small, had a clear smell of smoke even though floor was supposed to be smoke free, a flickering light and only one very small window. The response to my complaints was immediate and I was moved to another room on 19th floor (top floor). The new room was only a little bigger but had more windows and most important, was very clean. Being in an executive room, you can choose to have your breakfast either in the executive lounge or in the Square (the main restaurant at the hotel). I would certainly recommend the Square since the buffet is really extensive and to some extent also changes from day to day, which is important if you stay several nights. The lunch buffet is also very good and contains everything needed to taste people from everywhere, including Japanese, Chinese, Western and things I have absolutely no idea about what it was. For an even more interesting food experience, go to the near by China town but skip the tourist traps on e.g. Pagoda St. and head for one of the many food courts where many small outlets compete. One strange experience in such food court was that you have to order beer from one of the many ladies representing different beer companies competing about serving the guests but then you have to order food separately either directly from the counter of your chosen outlet or from another server that might work for one specific restaurant. Anyway, the food was always excellent and the price very reasonable. In conclusion I primarily liked the hotel because of its location, very green and calm area but still close enough to the buzz in the city center as well as busses and MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Chillipeppa
Reviews.Content: Its a very good hotel, big busy and usually full. I was fortunate to be upgraded to an executive room and had a bed of gigantic proportions to sleep in. The room had all the required amenities and for a change it is refreshing to find a hotel that does not charge extraordinary prices for internet, which was wired into the room rather than wireless..Other reviewers have mentioned that the hotel is far from restaurants and shops. The Orchard Rd shopping district is a $5.00 cab ride. Restaurants, however are plentiful and close. If one exits the hotel, turns left and walks up about 150 metres one will find a pedestrian overpass. Use it to cross the road and walk a few more metres in the same direction until you see a canal. Next to this canal are lots of restaurants and sidewalk cafes with a huge variety of cuisine styles. This is only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The staff are great and very helpful, willing and accommodating. If I get the same reasonable rate, I will definitely stay here again. In Singapore I used to book hotels at the airport - there is a very helpful desk and hotels with availability are usually much cheaper to book here than on their websites. However I booked this hotel on-line here at a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: RainbowBright7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the September F1 Grand Prix and some days after. This is a lovely hotel better than mid range. Staff are fantastic. We were upgraded, and we got a non smoking floor as requested. We could have had a smoking straight away but we opted to wait for the non smoking and during this we were offered a complimentary cocktail at the bar. Rooms are nice and spacious, we had a view of the pool. Good Location, very close to Clarke Quay and also close to Chinatown although a little further walk. Really enjoyed the stay and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: elekesla
Reviews.Content: The commencement of the day at this property is a more than a sumptuous International Breakfast Buffet. Hotel staff are particularly helpful and friendly. Rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. Located more in the business sector of the city, the Hotel partially suffers from being a little out of the way with most eating and shopping more than walking distance away. Robinson's Quay is a spirited walk and Clarke Quay with all the dining opportunities just out of easy reach. However the property does provide complimentary shuttle bus service to the fringe of Chinatown and Orchard Road. The traveller who wants a quiet and relaxing place to stay away from hustle and bustle will be rewarded. The waterfall bar is a feature and a nice place to relax. The outdoor pool is abundant in size. The sister Furama Cityview puts guests right into Chinatown for those who wish to be closer to shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: theCanuckNomad
Reviews.Content: I must say, for Singapore where supply is well below demand and hotels can virtually demand whatever price they deem as fair, this property is good value for your money. The staff are great and quite accommodating. I had booked a deluxe room and as they still had rooms available on their executive floor, they automatically upgraded me without having me to say so. Even though the deluxe rooms aren't bad, the executive floor comes with a proper workstation, mood lighting, complimentary internet & breakfast and access to the executive lounge. The greatest part of this upgrade is the internet. In this era of time, internet is a right not a privilege and not to be free. However, hotels still tend to charge absurd prices ($25+ a day) as it's profit margin is quite a bit and they are willing to forgo loyalty & customer retention for profit. Anyways, getting back to the Furama, remember it's a 4 star property and that is what it delivers. If you expect the rooms to be of a 5 star at a 4 star price, well in Singapore, that isn't going to happen. However for a 4 star it delivers what it promises and the pictures are true to the expectation. The only slight drawback is it's location. It's a bit out of the centre of town but then again Singapore is so small and taxis are cheap that nothing is over 10 minutes and over a $7 ride. Try it if you are looking for a good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “A great stop-over”
Reviews.Author: Marcel_Overseas
Reviews.Content: Stopped over at the Furama on the way home from Malaysia. Check-in was friendly and efficient and I was delighted with the upgrade to a deluxe room and a 3pm check-out on my last day. My room was clean, modern and quiet, with the world's biggest and firmest bed - just how I like it. The hotel is a little out of the way, but follow these tips and you'll be okay: 1) The hop-on-hop-off bus stop is located 100m up the road outside the Miramar Hotel. 2) For great food options, head in the same direction then cross Havelock Rd and head to Robertson Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Awesometravel7
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 fantastic nights at this hotel during 16-21 Sep 11. Initially at the check in, there was a little hiccup which almost scar our entire Singapore holiday. Having booked the room online with the offer of pay 3 stay 4 nights and came with one bonus breakfast, the manager in charge was adamant that it was a mistake and refused to honour the offer even though I showed her the print out copy of the bonus breakfast. She pushed the responsibility to the online agent and I begged to disagree. I suggested she check it out with the agent as the excuse given was unacceptable. To our delight, they informed us of the great news that we were entitled to a bonus breakfast. Apart from this incident, the room was spacious and clean, and my kids simply love the pool. Everyone from housekeeping to the counter staff to the concierge was extremely polite, welcoming and very friendly including the manager who handled our dispute. We definitely felt at home and made to feel like VIP guests. A special thanks has to go to the concierge team who relentlessly greeted, smiled, served and offered good advice whenever we were in the lobby entrance area. Their professionalism and 5 star service are one of the best if not the best I have ever come across in my 20 years of globetrotting and hotel staying. Well done, guys! All in all, service across the board was excellent! It was indeed a memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: yibbayibbada
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the hotel and like 3 years ago I wasn't disappointed. Arrived early and my room was ready - clean, quiet, spacious and relaxing. The staff are friendly and helpful and the buffet is as good as you are going to get in Singapore. Location of the hotel is great for a variety of interests. The pool is large and leaves enough room for everyone to enjoy. Would recommend to anyone looking for an all round good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: J D
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend of mine in November 2010. The location was excellent, close to shopping and close to Clarke Quay, which is where a lot of the bars and clubs are. We had a daily buffet breakfast included with our stay and it was quite good. The rooms weren't exactly the nicest, but were very clean and got the job done. The best part of the stay was the friendly doormen! They gave us great tips on where to go, what to see and ended up becoming our buddies during the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover”
Reviews.Author: stewga
Reviews.Content: Hotel & staff excellent service & attitude to every detail. Breakfast was great, alot to choose from. Singapore is shopping heaven, from markets to shopping malls. Helen the Tour person went out of her way to help us book tours for the 2 days we were there, loved the dinner cruise & the bus morning to Sentosa Island.Only problem was the hotel bar was too expensive,scotch & coke & a can od diet coke cost $28, so only drank there once. Otherwise everything was great, definitely would go there again, still so much to see & would stay at this hotel & would recommend to people.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in good location. Just a hiccup with our booking.”
Reviews.Author: Birchyk
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel on the entire trip that was booked for us by a travel agent & to begin with on check in it was established that we were a night short even though our documents stated “pay for 3 get the 4th night free”. The hotel only had us down for 3. I showed the girl the paperwork & she said she would check with the agent & get back to us. This was late afternoon so the agent in Australia would have been closed at this time. The receptionist who checked us in failed to inform us of breakfast & of our location or supply a map of the city. These I had to go & enquire about later & even then I was told very little. I wanted to go to the Singapore Bird Park & I was told we had to take a taxi to get there yet the very next morning when waiting for the Singapore Airline hop on off bus a bus for the bird park pulled up. This bus does a pick up everyday, as does one for the zoo, at the bus stop just up the road from the hotel yet we weren’t told about it as the hotel appears to really push you to use a taxi. There is no tourist information on display (not known if available) at Furama & I believe the hotel is more interested in the business traveler or tour groups. Not independent travelers. Need to improve their local knowledge for tourist & display that information as well. Anyway back to the story of the room. After going out for a walk we returned to our room to find a message that stated that our booking has been confirmed for 3 nights only & that if we wanted to stay another night it was going to cost us a further S$328. Being a bit annoyed at this I returned to the reception where I spoke with another girl who understood what I was talking about & also couldn’t understand why we only had 3 nights. I also expressed my dismay at how could the previous person have checked the booking when the Australian offices were closed. It would appear to me that this previous girl was not interested at all in the guests or going out of her way to help. The 2nd girl took details & would get back to me………………………in the mean time I emailed my agent about the drama’s. The following day I contacted my agent (& she emailed me a reply) that she had sorted out the hotels mistake. At this stage I still had not heard from the hotel. 2 days later we still hadn’t heard from the hotel about our booking so I spoke to the assistant manager to express my displeasure & complain about the service. She was understanding & I’ll give her credit did do something about it in that we received complementary internet access for the remainder of our stay & fruit baskets delivered to our room with an accompanying note of apology. However this error should not have occurred in the first place if those 2 girls had done their jobs properly. On the email subject – WHAT IS THE GO WITH EXPENSIVE HOTELS & INTERNET? Furama has a fee of S$25 a day for access!!!! $25 a day is down right theft! In all the hotels we have stayed at this trip, none prior to this have required a fee. None of those hotels were over S$80 a night. None gave us poor service! Hotels like Furama just want to make money ahead of guests’ enjoyment no doubt! Look at the prices they charge in the mini bar for a 2nd reference to a rip off. You can go down the street get a coffee & get free wifi, go into a shopping plaza/mall & get free wifi but pay expensive room rates and not get it!!!!!! As for the hotel itself it was beautiful – the rooms were fantastic, clean, comfortable & quiet. The breakfast was amazing with so much to choose from, all the staff, other than those 2 girls we first had dealings with, were very friendly especially the bellhops, who always had a smile on their faces & tried to give you a laugh.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and shop nearby.”
Reviews.Author: BASISPRADHAN82
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and you don't have to pay a whole lot of money. You walk out you find a small river and in the evenings take a round outside and across the street great open air eat outs and drinking places. Must visit them. breakfast and other buffet spreads are excellent. If you pay a little more you can get yourself an executive club room. Fantastic rooms they are and excellent added privileges as well. As anywhere in Singapore not too far from the air port or shopping malls. There are other hotels just next doors but this is a great one I must say. They have bus facility, taxis are lined up all through the day. I loved my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “You have to get the Executive Club room.”
Reviews.Author: The-Travel-eater
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Furama for 9 nights, after initially booking for 5. I had to extend my stay twice and was advised by the hotel to book via Expedia to get the better price. They were right. Once booked, I went to the reception and arranged to stay in same room and have continuity as if I'd originally booked for the duration. Hotel staff gave good advice to save me money and made this very easy to do. The main point I want to make about the Furama is regarding the Executive Club rooms. Only a small difference in price but the benefits far outweighed the additional cost. Main extras included in Exec is:-1. Late check-out of 16:00 hrs free, 2. Free breakfast buffet (excellent choice, plentiful and good quality), 3. Top 3 floor rooms with good view, 4. Free internet (wired in room & Wifi in rest of hotel.. usually £8 - £12 per day) & 5. Free drinks and snacks in Exec club between 6 & 8 pm every day. I can't say how good this was. The 'snacks' were plentiful and quality. Different menu each night but included Dim Dum, Satays, Noodles, Cakes, Sushi, Soups, etc, etc. All unlimited. If really on a budget there was plenty enough to be your evening meal. Drinks unlimited and unrestricted. The staff just kept offering. Even if you still had a full drink, they'd be round offering another. Getting Exec club is financially genius and I would recommend to anyone. As for the rest of the hotel, the staff are it's main asset. Very friendly and helpful. The rooms were cleaned to a high standard every day and, unlike other hotels, they will clean your room anytime you ask between 07:00 and 23:00. If you like a lie in, or a day in the pool, they'll come and clean your room at a time you specify. Brilliant. Location couldn't have been better. Clarke Quay just 10 mins stroll along the river. Chinatown just 15 mins walk. For a balanced review, I must mention the Indonesian Restaurant. Poor service, unfriendly staff and menu very limited. Got tricked into buying an additional meal that I didn't want. "Would you like boiled rice. yellow rice or fried rice?" Boiled and yellow was $6.00 each. Fried rice was actually Nasi Goreng.. a $17.00 main meal. Thanks for letting me know. Had to waste the lot and they wouldn't listen. Other than that, the hotel is Excellent and I would recommend the Exec Club rooms to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel with Good Service - Recommend”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: A great stopping off point - located in the heart of Singapore and close to almost anything (by Taxi that is). Nothing bad to report although the rooms are a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not strategically located...”
Reviews.Author: calvin_alex
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by my relatives and you need a cab to reach this place... The cab fares was not expensive and it cost me about $8.20 to travel from Clarke Quay to this hotel for 3 of us in a Hyundai cab... It could be cheaper if not for the traffic lights stop between each street... The rooms are more to a 3 to 4 star and we're very satisfied with the rooms overall... There are swimming pool and spas but did not manage to utilize it as we're staying for a short period...

Reviews.Title: “its good. actually just a 3.5”
Reviews.Author: heenja
Reviews.Content: Its comfortable, clean, has all the amenities that you would want. it meets all criteria you need for a hotel but thats all. nothing much to say. the indonesian restaurant is very good though. go eat there!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Domingan1878
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, rooms large and airy, breakfast buffet good and varied. It has a nice lounge / bar with happy hour til 8PM. Overall a great base to explore Singapore and a pleasant 15 min walk along the river to the lively areas of Clarkes Quay and Boat Quay. My friend stayed in the "Tropical wing" which is the older part of the hotel and the rooms were smaller and not as modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Facilities Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: harrissafety
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a short stay in July and from check in, to check out, the hotel can only be described as excellent. The staff were very professional and dealt with my request in regards to business services and local information. The hotel also has a very nice lounge bar where you can sit and relax and have a drink and bar food if you wish. The double club room room was of good size and the bathroom is what you would expect to find in a 5 star hotel. Overall I would recommend this hotel for both business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruud M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our adult son for 4 nights. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are very good with excellent beds. A plus is the swimming pool, which gives you the refreshment you need after a day in the town. Very close to a busstop of the SIA hopon-hopoff bus.

Reviews.Title: “A well-run establishment.”
Reviews.Author: Diana255068
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days here and enjoyed ourselves. The room was always kept very clean and was well set out. Our room looked out over lush vegetation in which a squirrel and birds played. The hotel is decorated in marble with large majestic pillars in the lobby. Understated and elegant with an Asian aesthetic. There is a lovely view over a waterfall from the bar. The concierges were extremely helpful and their advice was invaluable. The staff were all polite and helpful. There was a good spread at buffet breakfast and we never got bored with the fare. The hotel is a quick 15 minute walk to Chinatown which was one of our favorite haunts. Clarke Quay is further away but walkable. It is a long walk to Marina Bay Sands. There were plenty of taxis at the front of the hotel so it is easy to catch a ride from here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: varunpathak1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice with a impressive lobby, rooms were also very good sized and nicely furnished. View is very good from hotel windows. As the name suggest its very near Singapore River. An evening walk of 15 mins. will get you to Clarke Quay, which is alive frm eveng with restaurants and river cruises, another 15 mins. walk will take you to Marlion Park (Marina Bay). taxis are very easily available concierge is very helpful with all the queries. Also has a desk where tickets and transport is available if you wish to go to sentosa, universal studios, night safari etc. Overall excellent hotel with very good service and staff.

Reviews.Title: “WE ABSOLUTELY LOVED FURAMA RIVERFRONT AND WE'LL BE BACK!”
Reviews.Author: cy_wassell
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the service. Staff, very helpful and curteous. Friendly smiles everywhere, especially the staff at concierge. Room cleanliness very good. Household staff also very good and curteous and the rooms are nice and large. Restaurants are terrific, admittedly rather on the dear side, but if one books Furama as a holiday package which includes return airfare and staying more than 3 nights, one gets upgraded to a DELUX room and breakfast is included. VALUE FOR MONEY!! For those who love Indonesian food, try Kintamani Restaurant. Lovely food, warm welcome from staff. For international food the Square @ Furama is excellent. Absolutely love the fact that Furama is very close and within walking distance to the GREAT WORLD shopping centre, as well as cafes, and other eating places along the river and yet away from the ever-so-busy orchard Rd. We ate local food around the Great World practically every hourI LOVED IT! A big plus was the 'shuttle bus' that runs by the hour specially for the hotel guests. It goes to Orchard Road and Clarke Quay/China. We use it every day, It saved us a lot in taxi fares. To all staff at Furama Riverfront, a big thank you! You made us wanting to come back - we would recommend this hotel to anyone. Chrissy Wassell and Barry Cummings. CAN'T THINK OF ANYTHING NEGATIVE, REALLY - TO US, EVERYTHING WAS ON THE 'PLUS' SIDE. (YOU MIGHT THINK I AM A 'SHAREHOLDER' OF FURAMA RIVERFRONT, SO I STOP NOW - joke). THANKS TO ALL AT FURAMA RIVERFRONT, YOU REALLY MADE OUR HOLIDAY A VERY PLEASANT ONE AND WOULD RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “great country, city and hotel as well”
Reviews.Author: kumprash
Reviews.Content: Date: 04 July 2011 We booked this hotel for our stay in Singapore through Cox & Kings on their recommendation only. And it is a great hotel with pleasant ambience, really. We have stayed at many hotels over the years, often luxury ones with impeccable details and fantastic designs. It is the perceptive and friendly service that makes it worthwhile staying in this There is nothing wrong with the facilities. The room we had was spacious and pretty, the breakfast is good but lacking vegetarian food and the distance to the city centre is limited. They have arranged separate bed for our childrens at no cost. And as many people have written before. Furama Riverfront is a place you would definitely come back to and recommend to your friends. Thank you very much for making our stay so pleasant!!!

Reviews.Title: “A lazy weekend with the family.”
Reviews.Author: myopiczombie
Reviews.Content: We had the Executive room at the end of the corridor. Room is clean. Sofa and bed were comfortable. The Executive Club lounge was fantastic. Service and food was good. We were supposed to have breakfast at the Exec Club but opt to go to the Square. End up paying more than if we have it at the Exec Club. :( Was raining so we didn't go to the pool. Overall an enjoyable weekend albeit a lazy one - just watching tv!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ricky_NewDelhi_India
Reviews.Content: Was in this hotel for a day in July 2007. There was a shortage of rooms in this hotel when booked. So, my colleague & I had to share a double bed!! Overall, I enjoyed my stay in this hotel. But the meals were predominantly Chinese, having very few items catering to Continental taste and almost nothing for Indian taste. The shower was quite good but the bathroom had no provision to be locked from inside and there was a gap between the door and the frame. Thought it was a design feature and not a fault, I didn't really appreciate it!! The pool area was quite good, situated on first floor and surrounded by tropical pines. Though I didn't know about the free shuttle they have till much later, the MRT station was a short walk away. The view from my room was also quite nice, facing Holiday Inn and the city. But what really spoiled my experience there was the behaviour of staff while checking out. After my colleauge & I had boarded our cars, we were called back and told that we had consumed snacks in our room which we hadn't even seen to be present. In all probability, either they had forgotten to place it before checking in or the Room Service had to do something with its disappearance. Anyway, I didn't pay for it and they had to accept their fault.

Reviews.Title: “we had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: jwalantjoshi
Reviews.Content: last month when we visited Singapore, we stayed at furama riverfront. it was a great experience to stay. rooms were good. food and specially morning breakfast was superb.location of the hotel was also good. its worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Good place ot far from CBD”
Reviews.Author: SaumilSShah
Reviews.Content: The overall good experience. For short stay and also i between orchard road and city centre. the buffest breakfast was quite filling and had a good layout. the bar had some good music and variety of wines that one can pick from. they had some good house wines aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended at all ! Stay Out for Business”
Reviews.Author: victor888
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on the 27th till 29th of May. We reached the hotel at 1am in the morning and was told that the twin bed we had booked was not available, despite we had fully paid for the hotel charges online. End up, me and my colleague have to share the double bed...ridiculuous. The next day, we used the internet service in the hotel room, and it mentioned the maximum charges is SGD25 per day. We started using from 7pm in the evening on the 28th until 10am 29th when we checked out. Guess what...the hotel charged us SGD50 for that. I told them they had made a mistake but their front desk attitude is so bad...since we are rushing for a meeting , we checked out and we did not want to argue with them We told them this is the last time i am going to stay there. In addition, the bathroom shower water pressure is so weak ...we did not complain at all. ..Stay out from this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flashjack92
Reviews.Content: What a magnificent hotel. We had a beautiful room, from the front desk to the cleaning staff, wonderful friendly people and nothing was a bother to them. They have a courtesy (no charge) bus to take you into Orchard Rd for shopping and will return you to the hotel. The food there especially the breakfasts were superb. We will definitely stay there again. Close to Chinatown and Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel will stay there again on next visit to Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: golf9-11
Reviews.Content: Staff made check in and out very easy also very friendly and helpful. Received free upgrade to Deluxe Room which was big ,quiet and very comfortable, Transport:- Bus stops very close, MRT approx 15mins walk (along river to Clark Quay) and 30,000 Taxi's very cheap. Bars and Restaurants on the riverfront 5 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - value for money, but...”
Reviews.Author: WeekendTravellers77
Reviews.Content: It's a nice place to stay but it is away from the main city. The rooms were large and spacious and we asked for connecting rooms, which made our lives simpler. I would recomend travellers to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: pac29
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the Jet airways website and I must say I had a good deal of 4300INR per night. The hotel does not allow you to check in early and I had to use the pool bathroom to get ready and run for my meeting. The people are friendly and the concierge welcomed me by name in the evening when I had to collect my bags. There is a gas station across the road where you could buy all the regular 711 stuff

Reviews.Title: “just another place”
Reviews.Author: lintoj
Reviews.Content: in singapore where taxis r tough to find when rain comes which is often stay near an MRT(local metro) or bus stop. furama is far from any of these. the lobby and restaurants are pleasing to eye, rooms are not, good pool. check out at 12 but u can keep the luggage with the hotel and when u come back to collect it can use the rest rooms to freshen up.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but slightly expensive”
Reviews.Author: droyjohn
Reviews.Content: Good and clean hotel with courteous staff.Room service was slightly late.All other services satisfactory.Expensive hotel for food.Rooms slightly small for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Steddy17
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at this hotel in March. Stayed in a Club Room which was clean and modern, and of a reasonable size by Singapore standards. Had a choice of breakfast in the restaurant or club lounge, we chose the main restaurant and the selections available were very good. Evening drinks and snacks in the club lounge was very enjoyable and the staff were very helpful and friendly, as were all staff throughout the hotel. As we were staying 5 nights we requested a different style of white wine, as there standard white was too sweet for us. The next and subsequent nights we were provided with a very satisfactory drier white wine. Location of hotel is quite good, just a short walk to Robertson Quay. This hotel employs quite a few trainess, with some from other countries. The one's we met were always very friendly and helpful, and left a good impression.

Reviews.Title: “Could do much better!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisB460211
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and our overall impression was one of slight disappointment. The facade and lobby are quite impressive but the 'Superior' rooms we had booked were certainly not. They were very tired and in need of urgent refurbishment and had a musty smell. The extractor was not working in the bathroom, and it hadn't been working for some time as the inside of the door was going rotten due to condensation after showering. The room stat was also fixed so you couldnt adjust the temperature of the room. Our friends were totally disatisfied with their room and requested a change which was reluctantly agreed by one of the reception staff. At breakfast there was a wide choice of food for all tastes but the 'hot' food tended to be only lukewarm. It might have helped a little if the plates were pre-heated. Our flight from Singapore was not until midnight and we requested a late checkout which they couldn't grant us as they said the hotel was full, however, the concierge will keep your luggage and there are changing facilities with showers and towels adjacent to the swimming pool which we used and that did work out well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel within a short taxi ride to the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: catcam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Furama Riverfront and found it be good value for money. There is a free shuttle bus from the hotel to Orchard Road which runs regularly through the morning and late afternoon. The bathroom could do with a good bleach and the beds were quite firm but the breakfast is great and the staff very helpful. Taxi rides are cheap to all the main attractions and taxi drivers very proud of their country. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Furama - Value for money”
Reviews.Author: redds_77
Reviews.Content: Furama Riverfront's location is excellent, you can walk to Robertson quay on the Singapore river in about 5 mins from this hotel and have excellent varieties of food. The waterfall lounge in the hotel itself is quite good for having drinks and entertaining guests. I liked the rooms and the facilities in the room. The rooms are spacious and are very well equipped with general stuff that travelers need.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Ukwedcouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently and everything was so great. Our room was okay but the service from staffs would say it all. From concierge, to restaurant and reception. Evryone gives their best smiles. Would say thank you to Ms. Ma Jaycel who has been very nice to us, checking how we are everytime she see us. She makes us feel like her family. Thank you. We enjoyed everything and wishe to come back. Will tell this to our friends. See you again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: 1tassiedevil2
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 2:30 am and went straight to bed. When we woke up we discovered that there was a problem with the temperature of the hot water.Despite allowing the shower to run for a considerable time we could not receive any hot water.A call to the front Desk resulted in an almost immediate visit by a maintenance worker. he could not rectify the problem at that time. The Front Office Manager arrived on the scene and immediately made arrangements for a change of rooms. At this point we went for a tour of the city. On our return we discovered that we had been upgraded to an executive room complete with a bowl of fresh fruit and a wonderful bouquet of fresh flowers. More surprising was a letter signed by all 18 members of the Front Desk Team apologizing for the water problem and hoping that we would enjoy our stay in Singapore. We could not have wished for a better resolution of our problem. We found all staff extremely pleasant to deal with. They were attentive, supportive and keen to ensure that your visit was a good experience. The breakfast buffet was extensive and well presented. We will undoubtedly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Mubzz
Reviews.Content: The stay was along with a group Travel. The check-in for the entire group was managed well, the rooms allocated were basis our preferences. Malls are walkabale distance, good sourrounding, street food joints nearby. Overall a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with only minor issues”
Reviews.Author: BlueNinja
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing - it looks good, the room (Executive Suite) was comfortable, room service was timely and delicious, staff were very helpful. I have only very minor complaints about the hotel: Internet service, though free, cuts you off at 500mb of data transfer (that's upload AND download). You just have to refresh to restart it. Minor annoyance, trying to get 3 months of updates done this way. Laundry, nowhere within walking distance I could find had a laundromat, and the hotel laundry room (2 washers, 2 dryers) cost $8 EACH. MRT is at least half a mile away, and walking in the humidity is dramatically sweat-causing. The upsides, however: Amazingly comfortable bed, and chairs, and couch - just very great place to relax.
