Room service was prompt (<30 minute wait both times we ordered) and good, though pricey (but expected because hey, it's room service). Breakfast buffet had a good variety of American and local foods, fresh juice, and no rush from the staff. Always taxis waiting downstairs, no wait to get out and go see the city. Internet service was great speed-wise and no difficulty to set up. Did require ethernet cable in the room, but wireless in public areas (like the buffet). Pool was pretty cool, only four feet deep but good for laps and in the shade in the morning (nice for those of us who sunburn easily). If I come back to Singapore, this is the place I will look to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not so good, and bad.”
Reviews.Author: Bushbabie
Reviews.Content: Good points: friendly staff, room adequate and clean (although the stated mini bar was just an emtpy fridge) Bad..... oh dear, where to start...... breakfast buffet- incredible range of foods for all cultures but hot food was never more than tepid. Fruit juices- watery concentrates, such a shame when freshly squeezed is available on every street corner. Housekeeping very erratic, one morning woken at 8 by them wanting to clean the room, another day back from a tour at 4 and the room still not done. Biggest failing was inflexibility on check out. Checked out at noon, went on a tour till 5 but that still left 6 hours until late night airport pick up. Could we have a room to rest and shower? No. Their options were to sit in the bar- and be pestered to buy drinks all evening, no thanks not at $25/ £12 for 2 lemonades! Or we could sit round the pool- lovely, get hot and sweaty wearing the clothes we will be travelling in for the next 20 hours. We ended up getting an earlier cab to the airport, at least you can get a reasonable priced drink and snack there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dalevon
Reviews.Content: After reading all the good reviews, I myself experienced the good service and nice rooms furama Riverfront hotel offered. The staff were super nice. And the good thing I was even upgraded for free at the executive suite room...The room was really nice. It has a large comfortable bed and pillows and the bathroom was excellent and trendy. While soaking and relaxing on your bathtub, you can watch shows on your LCD TV cos the bathroom has glass panels. It was like havin a spa inside your room. The breakfast buffet was very good too, lots of selections. I would definitely will stay here on my future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, a bit far from the action”
Reviews.Author: MochaChoca
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 weeks in a room overlooking the pool. Everything about the hotel was average, from the dated hotel rooms to the the service. The room was of average size with big windows, a mini-bar and safe. The towels were very thin, though they did provide a gown and slippers. Breakfast was quite good, though the waitering staff service not so good. Local phone calls were cheap from the room phone. They were very good with wake-up calls even sending someone to your room to wake you up if you didn't answer the phone. The luggage storage service and message service at the concierge was also very efficient. Checking in was a bit of a process, and they required a deposit for extra charges, which I considered strange since the room was already paid for. Checking out was very quick. There was very cheesy hotel lobby music daily, by not very talented singers. For entertainment I recommend the short walk to the nearby Robertsons or Clark Quay. The main disadvantage is that the hotel is not very centrally located and is a fair walk to the nearest metro station. There is a bus stop outside the hotel, however the bus system is difficult to navigate. Taxis regularly stop at the hotel, though it can take a while to get one in the evening. The hotel was used for a number of functions while I stayed there, so many evenings there were long queues for taxis. There are also some KTV bars/clubs next door, which means that there are some very drunk people stumbling around on weekend nights. One big disadvantage was that there was no free wifi in the rooms, only a very expensive internet cafe in the lobby or a cable in the room that required you to pay a ridiculous daily rate.

Reviews.Title: “Well trained, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TravellovingAussie
Reviews.Content: First trip to Singapore. Stayed 5 nights over New Year' Eve and early January. Location was o.k. 5 minute walk to New World ? s/centre. Short taxi ride anywhere else or 10 minute walk to subway stop. Had 2 interconnecting rooms.The staff here were some of the friendliest overall we have encountered in many trips to Asia. Not in the heart of the city but very easy to get anywhere. Minimart at the petrol station around the corner. Breakfast was expensive so get it included in the rate if possible. Fantastic buffet but at AUS$70 for a family a bit too much. They should look at having a family price for breakfast. We thought we could just find small local cafes/restaurants nearby but there are none that serve breakfast, not that we could find anyway. Big mistake. First lesson we have learnt. Good pool area if that's your thing. Quite large for this class of hotel in a city and not crowded at all. They have 2 tour operators with desks downstairs. One was good the other very average. Go to the busy one! The shopping centre nearby has a great supermarket and plenty of quality restaurants for lunch and dinner, they just don't open 'til about 11am. Five mins in a taxi gets you to Queensway s/centre is good for sports gear and cheap laksas. Try the lady who makes coconut and peanut steamed sweets yummy!! and there is another s/centre across the road which is good also. Shopping centres don't seem to fully open before about 11am.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service - but facelift of hotel needed”
Reviews.Author: Fredrik-on-the-go
Reviews.Content: Staff is really fantastic, from front desk, night shift to club lounge staff. But like one of the staff put it: "We cannot compete with 5 star hotels in the facility, but we can with service..."

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel..Comfortable..Good Service but rooms need some improvements”
Reviews.Author: The_Rottweiler
Reviews.Content: Got a good room rate off wotif and was quite satisfied with the room standards for a mid priced hotel just off the Clarke Quay area. Taxi's are neccessary to get from the hotel to Orchard road. China town is nearby (20 minute walk) so lots of local food outlets at People's Park Shopping Center as well as Outram Park MRT station (20 minute walk). Service was excellent from the front desk staff to the bell captains. Rooms are clean, comfortable but if you can get past the fact the hotel is a little bit old, the hotel is fine. I would def. stay again. For me, price for a hotel room is a factor as it's hard to find decent priced hotels in downtown Singapore these days. Internet in the room was not free. Had a standard or deluxe room. My room didn't come with breakfast but that wasn't a problem for me as I prefered eating out.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, we highly recommend it!!”
Reviews.Author: asialover24
Reviews.Content: We were traveling on a Singapore Airlines package and we expected nice accommodations but we were shocked at how nice this hotel was. It was way beyond our expectations. Very easy check in. Great, spacious room, clean and modern bathroom. Beautiful lobby and lounge area. Two tour desks in the lobby. Custom tailor shop in lobby. We bought two suits which were ready in 48 hours--said they could get them finished in 12 hours if necessary. Taxis always available. About one block to the hop on-hop off bus stop. Restaurant was very nice, large, wide selection of foods to suit every taste. Seems to specialize in leisurely dining which gives you time to sample everything on the buffet.. Overall we had a great stay and highly recommend the Furama Riverfront. By the way, it is not on the river.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Bundygirl56
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with fantastic service. We stayed in one of the executive suites on the top floor. The view was stunning. The club floor priviliges were fantastic, with an exclusive breakfast in the club lounge and also the evening cocktalis and nibblies provided in the late afternoon. Unlimited use of internet was free as well. The service in the hotel and in the club lounge was exeptional. The entertainer in the ground floor lounge was fantastic as well. This was our 3rd visit to the city, but our firts stay in this hotel. I certainly would choose this beautiful hotel for my next stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “I can understand why it has won awards for the best mid range hotel”
Reviews.Author: keisand
Reviews.Content: We felt comfortable at the Furama. It is well appointed, the staff are very courteous and professional, and breakfast is a treat. We would certainly return. Study your map and ask enquiries desk for bus numbers to destinations and they will assist. Take the time to get an EZ transit card from one of the MRT (rail) stations located around town, as it is a very easy form of travel. Chinatown is 2 bus stops away and you can enjoy the local food. Clarke Quay is over rated. Tell the waiters to take away anything they put on the table that you did not order, or you will pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: selvan_koilpillai
Reviews.Content: Located in a decent place with lots of greenary around. great interiors at reception and lounge. very clean rooms with best room service. great spa with variety relaxing service. Food is great tast. Reching is easy as all drivers knows by name. Stay in the maximum level to get panaromic view of singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Hotel - But Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: kalwells
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on a multi-stop trip through malaysia. The hotel is clean and tidy, and staff are freindly, but the rooms (Superior Rooms) are far from Superior! I travelled with friends, and bearing in mind the rest of our trip had been 5* hotels all the way, my expectations were fairly well established. However, when we got our room keys, the room I was in had 3 single beds, crammed in the same room, and the room was dark, damp smelling and musty. It was also a smoking room, and as a non smoker I found it very difficult to breath in there with the smell of stale smoke! I complained to the reception, who advised that the hotel was full, and that this room was a superior tower room.... I commented that it was not of a superior standard, being dark and damp and smelly with 3 beds crammed in! The manager then came out to see me and I explained my concerns, she advised that she agreed perhaps the wording of superior was incorrect, especially for european people! In a bid to solve the complaint she moved myself and friend to an executive room on the 18th floor.... well, what a change! airy light rooms, great bathrooms and bedroom areas, space to move and no smells!!!! With the room came a lovely selection of benefits, one of which was access to the executive lounge for breakfast in the morning, and also between 5-8pm drinks and nibbles also - all free!!!!!! Ok, so these were added extras, but it does highlight that they seem to mis-sell the superior room, it really was no more different to the Travel Lodge in the UK, basic, dull and non inviting..... Be carefull if you book this room type, and I would without a doubt ask to be upgraded to the Executive Rooms.... The rest of the hotel was fine, nice and clean, food very good, staff very nice. They have a lovely pool area which is normally quite, sadly the views were obscured by a haze from nearby forest burning, which had been hovering over singapore for around 3 days. The driver of our car that collected us from the airport explained it happened last year and did not clear for weeks!!! However, this aside the hotel is Excellent walking distance to the main shopping areas, and a short cab ride away (approx £3) to the new shopping district with EVERY designer name possible! Total shopping heaven if you love retail shopping!!! I spent a fortune in singapore dollars, but only half of it in UK Pounds!!! you have to love the 2.4 dollar - 1 UK Pound exchange rate! Would recommend Sinapore to anyone who likes to experiance culture, as well as modern touches and life, just be careful of what hotel you book!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fred_8184
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 4 nights and we were both quite happy with it! We were greeted as we got out of the car and were made to feel very welcome from that moment. As we didn't have a credit card they simply emptied the mini bar and we were good to go. The room was quite spacious, more than enough room for 2 people and the beds were quite comfortable. All staff members were extremely friendly and helped us whenever we needed it. Great pool area, small gym but big enough for people on holidays, very nice buffet breakfast which caters for all, and a small shop selling souveniers, drinks etc in the lobby area which is good if you want to grab a bottle of water or can of coke while at the hotel. Yes it is quite a walk to get to the train station but catching a taxi cost us about $4 to Chinatown then just took the train from there - It was about $9 to Sentosa by taxi. We weren't due to fly out until 11.50pm and so had a 4.00pm checkout. We ended up checking out in the morning but were told that we could use the showers by the pool to freshen up before we were picked up to be taken to the airport. It was greatly appreciated after having a warm day out,and then having to sit on a plane for about 6 1/2 hours. Overall it was a great place to stay, just a little further from the MRT than we were wanting.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mypo
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel was excellent. We were able to access room early upon arrival from airport transfer. Lobby excellent, some of the other environments were tired. We had a "superior" room booked but the room did not meet this expectation however it was clean, beds were comfortable good TV and a room safe. The included breakfast was good value and goes to 10.30am. The drawback to this hotel is that the bar downstairs charged very high prices which made just having a drink or coffee in the hotel unaffordable and the hotel is not close to other cafes ect. We used taxis to get us around and we found this affordable as the hotel is a distance from the city centre. There was no river close by!. Pool area nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel however not it the greatest of locations and old rooms.”
Reviews.Author: iloveholidaysAUS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some friends and hired twin bedrooms. The rooms are fairly old however and the bed wasn't very comfortable. No included breakfast was a bit of a bummer for tourists. Good clean toilet/bathroom. Location not the best as it is far from the nearest MRT (20 min walk) and would need to catch a cab to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Dont' hesitate when booking this hotel you wont be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DP196
Reviews.Content: We went to Singapore for the formula 1 and stayed at the Furama River Front which was excellent all round. The location was within minutes of the main sites and town center. The hotel also had a regular shuttle service which ran to and from these sites making it convenient and easy to organise a day out. The hotel itself was beautiful with clean and great sized rooms. There was a large pool, great spa and gym facilities for the guests. The hotel offered everything that we needed especially on the food front, the hotels own restaurant was amazing especially the chicken satay and in general the atmosphere in all areas of the hotel was wonderful. If you are thinking of staying at this hotel then don't hesitate you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Smiles all round, part if their family”
Reviews.Author: Evan_the_middle_one
Reviews.Content: I am staying here now, my third night and have to report that you cannot fault the personal service of the Dior staff. All the issues with the price of the bar ($30 a beer) pale in importance to the training these men on the door must have had to make you feel like a valued guest. I walked in the door of the lobby a few moments ago and was greeted by my name! A hotel if over 700 guests, with a turn over if possibly 300 or more a night... This means commitment to service!!! On arriving a few nights ago and leaving my lap top at the airport I was not only rang by the door men upon my return to express their concern, but business collegues were asked the next day to see if I had recovered said item. Today we were all reminded to remember our belongings on alighting from a bus... How shaming LOL ALL these instances show you just how genuiningly concern the staff are about your welfare, a lovely way to feel upon being in a home away from home. Stay for a few nights and feel a part of a family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinya21
Reviews.Content: Group of 6 stayed at the Furama RiverFront Hotel during the Singapore Grandprix. From the moment we arrived the staff made us feel welcome and did everything they could to make our stay pleasant during our stay. The rooms were spacious, modern and well maintained. Hotel is based in a great location. We enjoyed every bit of our 5 nights stay there, worth every penny spent. Highly recommend this hotel if you are in Singapore on business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay when visiting Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Jiggs147
Reviews.Content: The welcome was very smooth, arrived at 8am and the room was ready even though check in later. The room was perfect, spacious, clean and great facilities. They offer a shuttle service to the main places to visit. Breakfast was brilliant, they have a Balinese restaurant in the hotel which is a 'must', food was authentic and will blow you away. I have stayed at 2 different hotels in Singapore and this is by far better, i know where i will be staying. Brilliant place.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: auschickee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at furama riverfront befor and after we went on cruise. They were very obliging, didnt have to wait for room to be ready.Room was clean and modern. Air conditioner was tricky to regulate so we turned it off as it was too cold. Breakfast was included and had everything you could imagine. Everyone was curtious as most are in singapore, my only gripe was their bar lounge, the girls couldnt understand english, were unbelievably SLOW to the point that we could have walked to the river and sat had a wine and walked back again and still wouldnt be served. Drinks were expensive as well, so next time we would go to the river bars. Other than that it was good value, convienant, for the money we paid. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Big Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Efleet
Reviews.Content: this hotel offers nice big room! big bathroom, and the service is up to the standard. it is a four star hotel afterall and very pleasant to stay in. However, the receptionist might take a 'little' too long to process our document and get ready for the room, anyway, it is not really a big for me because i'm not in rush. I would definitely recommend to friends and it is quite easy to catch a cab! haha

Reviews.Title: “No river frontage but a pretty good offering all the same”
Reviews.Author: MaxsterPerth
Reviews.Content: Our original room here was horrendously over-priced and very disappointing but after changing rooms we found our view of the hotel changed. I liked the location of this hotel as it was a short walk to Robertson Quay and the river and a slightly longer walk to Clark Quay. The food was good here, particularly the breakfasts but I was disappointed there was no service by the pool. A pretty good hotel in a nice part of town (very close to the Boomerang for any Aussie travellers). No major complaints besides the original room being a shocker!

Reviews.Title: “Value, but beds leave a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before and I don't recall having these awful mattresses then. This time we're on the 5th floor in a "superior pool view room". The room is pretty basic with a double and a single bed, one bedside table only, one table/chair set, and one wall/reading light. This makes it difficult for the other occupant to read in bed. The worst part is the rock-hard mattresses and fat, nylon pillows. It makes lying in bed feel as if you're a piece of meat on a butcher's block! If we hadn't already pre-paid, we would be out of here. Room maid has not replenished coffee/tea station in 3 days now. Gym is adequate but air-con is not functioning adequately and you feel too hot to continue workout after about 15-20mins. We are in S'pore many times a year on business and have used most hotels, but at $190/nt here, I am certain we could do better. Incidentally, Furama City Centre has modernised, business-style rooms but we chose here - win some, lose some. We'll not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Simon63
Reviews.Content: Although by no means new,this hotel has been kept in good condition and has a sizeable lobby and rooms in two towers. Although I requested a non smoking room and had stayed there a number of times previously (so it should have been in my guest history), I was given a key to a smoking room. However, the duty manager sorted it out quickly and gave me a complimentary upgrade to the next room category. The rooms are reasonably spacious with a large double bed and proper cotton sheets and comfortable mattress. The bathroom includes a bath. It is reasonably convenient by taxi for both Orchard road area and the city being to the south of the Singapore River. The MTR is a good 10 minute walk away and there are no attractions in the exact locality. The Waterfall lounge offers happy hour drinks from about 3pm. The pool is between the two wings and loses sun quite early. For the price, it represents good value with good quiet rooms and a convenient location. The doormen are particularly helpful. Their sister hotel, Furama City, is better placed for the MTR and some of the rooms which have recently been renovated are better but overall it has more of a 3* rather than 4* feel and I prefer Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “need update”
Reviews.Author: deb-5584
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, the hotel lobby area are pretty good, the room need an upgrade. A little facelift may be will make it better, however it has a good service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update & don't buy a coffee in the bar!!”
Reviews.Author: Belz2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights whilst in transit home to break the journey. The welcome by the Front Office staff (both at the door and Reception) was excellent, warm and friendly. The lobby area is first class. But, some of the floors could obviously be seriously refurbished. The hallways in parts look like a battle zone with collision marks and scuffs all over the walls. This aside, the room was comfortable with a lovely view over the pool area. The bathroom was small but clean, but the lighting could have been a liitle better in there. And the shower/bath was a challenge until we figured it out! The breakfast was excellent with a large variety of options. Overall, if you're not too fussy, it's pleasant hotel to stay. Just don't buy a coffee from the bar on the ground floor....it might bankrupt you. Close to the riverfront and Clarke Quay, a bit far from Orchard Road if you're walking.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: cassiiejo
Reviews.Content: stayed her on route to australia nice spacious room good food really pleasant experience the staff were very nice and it was handy to shopping malls all in all very good,

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: WalterKuhn
Reviews.Content: For a one night stay in Singapur, I used the Furama Riverfront. Elegant, great room (19 floor - executive), good service. Only, the location is not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: polly1996
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed two nights on route to Australia, but would have liked to stay longer. Super hotel, great food, good value. The staff were helpful, friendly and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: pat0046
Reviews.Content: Not near anything except a native food mall where you can get anything that moves to eat.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in sigapore”
Reviews.Author: say2arun
Reviews.Content: i stayed in faruma for 3 nights .iThe hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before.rooms are 2 spacious .in nutshell my stay was worth of money .

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but a little dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: peertje
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Furama for 2 nights after a long search on the internet for a decent (and affordable) hotel in Singapore. Picked this one because of all the good reviews. We paid 110 Euro (US$133) for the room per night, breakfast not included. But we were actually a little dissapointed, for this price and certainly after all the great reviews. The rooms are just OK but are getting a little outdated, the bathroom a litte small and old. Also, it's quite noisy, we could hear everyone having showers in the morning. The swimming pool was average, a cold water Jacuzzi and a pool that's about it. I think the whole hotel is starting to wear a bit. Service was fine but nothing memorable and I think it's really crazy you pay for the Internet, this should be free, especially in a hotel like this. Location wise we liked it, it's walking distance to the city and china town and lots of good and cheap eateries around. I guess it's probably one of the better hotels you'll get in Singapore but don't think would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with lots of space”
Reviews.Author: thinkinside
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Friendly staff who managed to give us a room before the check-in time as we arrived early say, 3-4 hours before check-in time. Good room, very spacious. Good breakfast and very easy to get hold of transporatation. The frontage of the hotel is very huge with lots of open space (guess common area along with hotels). Many hotels nearby and also guess Zouk is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Glen82
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Singapore. This time around I traveled with a very large group from work (close to 250 people) and stayed at the Furama Riverfront Hotel for 2 nights. We had a fixed itinerary to follow which included Universal Studios along with other Sentosa attractions and hence didn't spend a lot of time in the Hotel. However, comparing it with the hotels from my earlier trip to Singapore, this hotel definitely has a few positives. One is definitely the location. Its about a 5-10 mins walk (and about 5 SGD by cab) from Clarke Quay and the Outram Park MRT station. Thus traveling to Clarke Quay and Harbourfront (enroute to Sentosa) were extremely easy. We stayed on a twin sharing basis and my room was on the 8th floor. The rooms (including the bathroom) were quite comfortable and not at all cramped. There is a decent sized bathtub with a shower. The TV was not an LCD or plasma which I found quite surprising. Also, there were too few channels (english) available. The breakfast at the hotel is the bare minimum that one would expect and I wouldnt call it lavish. Also, the staff were polite and courteous but lacked that extra warmt that one is used to receiving in Singapore. I guess that had more to do with the huge crowd that they had to deal with. Since this was a fully sponsored trip, I dont exactly know how much we paid for the night but considering the Expedia price (INR 6500 a night), i think it was completely worth the price. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Singapore. However, honeymooners might want to consider other hotels which offer more luxury and shopaholics might want to stay closer to Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Good value luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 255100Peter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Furama 2 nights and could not rate it more highly. Not sure what the problem is with other negative reports. Everything good ! Only slightly misleading thing is the name Riverfront actually 5 minutes walk from River but still a good location. 15 minutes walk to Clarke Key.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the room you get”
Reviews.Author: Good_Tiding
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Furama Riverfront on and off for two weeks due to travel within the region and had mixed experiences. Getting the right room is tricky, I had stayed in 4 different rooms each one varying in terms of cleanliness. If you get stuck with an unclean room make sure you let the front desk know; they are accommodating enough to help you get a room of your choice if available. The air-conditioning in some rooms is either broken or old and cranky. Again no point complaining, just get the room changed. The breakfast buffet is average and can get very crowded between 8:30 - 9:30am. If you are looking for basic breakfast it serves well. Internet speeds are good and reliable. Not much to say about the service - it is neither great nor lousy. The location of the hotel is great and quite centralized. It is a 25 min taxi ride to and from the Changi Intl airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth saying 4 star!!!will not recommend to others certainly!!!!”
Reviews.Author: APRNB
Reviews.Content: if u want a four star hotel --there are certain expectations that go with it espec. if u have stayed in 4 stars before.Here at Furama they charge for simple water and a mini packet of nuts exhorbitantly and keep it around in your rooms as if to make it appear complimentary????Then they say that it was a mini bar item but kept outside the refridgerator.At the rates they have they should give it complimentary or if they dont atleast the guests shoud be told that though these items are on your table u will have to pay through your nose for it. Definitely not 4 star atttitude of the staff.Their Managers always seem to be in meetingsand not available for customers . bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel @ the right place”
Reviews.Author: Mogambo1
Reviews.Content: I picked up this hotel for my first family trip outside India. This was quite a good choice with lots of freebies. Thier morning breakfast is too good. I had the free Internet service also, although it's not free. Close to the Metro Station & Shopping place. Very close to river side.... Worthwhile to visit again or choose.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: whistlestop
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel mainly because they upgraded our room and we stayed in the tropical wing, room was spacious and very quiet. The location here is actually very good although reading other reviews it seems most people don't agree. If you turn right out of the hotel and cross the foot bridge there are buses which will take you to Orchard Road, Little India and along the river. We did not eat breakfast here as its overpriced, instead we crossed the bridge to Robertson Quay a 5 minute walk and ate along the river....the choice is either the Gallery Hotel or Boomerang. Turning left out of the hotel will take you to some local restaurants one of which we liked very much. Also you are within walking distance 15 minutes to Great World City which has Starbucks and plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but not 4 star rating.”
Reviews.Author: ScottyAngel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a evening after our Austrailia holiday, found the staff to be quite cold and unfriendly. The gym was VERY small for a hotel of this size and the pool was below standard. The breakfast was OK but not of a 4 star standard. Location wise wasn't bad but could have been closer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Annabelle1390
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located.. We loved our stay here! Singapore is a wonderful place, and if you are going there, it is best if you stay in the Furama River Front.. There is a river nearby with a lot of cafes.. The surroundings are so modern and stylish. The hotel inside has a couple of bars and restaurants, don't miss the opportunity to visit them. Furama is within a walking distance from all the hot spots of Singapore. And the tour bus stop is just 2 minutes away! It was a really pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but mediocre location”
Reviews.Author: vacationtime2000
Reviews.Content: Husband stayed here for business. The hotel seemed to be geared towards business guests. The front staff service was spotty. Some of the staff were very aloof and didn't want to be bothered with assisting me. The SPA was even worse. I walked in ... saw the attitude and ... immediately walked out. I didn't want to pay for an overpriced massage with an unhappy masseuse who didn't really want to be there. I had to take cabs everywhere because the hotel was located in an odd location. Not too far from anywhere but not too close to any good restaurants or shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BadSector
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great stuff, very good restaurant. I had everything I wanted before I ask for it. I felt like a king. I stayed at the business room which was clean and comfortable. The only problem was the internet but I guess it is a Singapore general problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! Average rooms, but all in all a decent place to spend a few days.”
Reviews.Author: farighkaum
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was not bad, close enough to public transport and got you to pretty much anywhere in a short cab ride. The staff was very nice, from check in to check out the process was pretty seamless. The concierge and front door staff was really helpful and guided us with pretty much everything we needed help with. Would not mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and pleasant hotel but location not great”
Reviews.Author: PrashantSarin
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and pleasant experience. Location is not great. You can get many hotels near the main happening area at the same price. We had gone during the F1 Race so it was not a bad deal. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: familyroaming
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights on a stopover and our price for an executive suite also included breakfast (SD$666). The room was large enough for us and our two children and included a bath which was a great bonus. It was not flash, but comfortable, clean and spacious. The breakfast was fine. Not a brilliant location, but a quick taxi ride to Chinatown and the Satay night market which is worth a visit. Good to have a pool too when you have children. They loved that.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Short Term Stay”
Reviews.Author: shazhunter
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel by our cruise company as we were staying only 1 night each side of the cruise dates. The hotel itself is a little tired and dated however the service is very good and the breakfast was quite good value for money $16 continental and $25 full buffett. The second stay we were given a room facing Havelock Road which was a total noisey nightmare as there is a nightclub directly accross the road and we were woken to the sounds of constant boom boom boom at 3am. All staff there was polite and courteous and willing to help. Hotel is a little far out of town however there is a bus stop outside the Mirimar Hotel which is just a short walk from the Furama on the same side of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good tip for stopover for flights to Indonesia and Australia”
Reviews.Author: LubomirD
Reviews.Content: Middle luxus of rooms, ratehr too expensive restaurant, too expensive bar in lobby. Good conection with downtown. Short honest walk to Chinatown with famous mosques, chinatemples and hindu-temple.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larryaustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights , staff fantastic and very helpful,buffet breakfast was very good , happy hour in Waterfall garden was good value , only drawback is the internet fees are to dear ,but would stay again Larry AUSTRALIA

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: manguniboy
Reviews.Content: stayed at furama riverfront for 2 nights, booked a superior room through their website, and when checking in, they told me that i've been upgraded to deluxe !!!!!! room was very very very clean. staff was helpful. breakfast was awesome, (better than furama chinatown and riverview). however the only thing i didn't like was it's location. it's far from everything. there's no MRT nearby. and there's no free internet :( (here in indonesia the majority of hotels offer free internet)

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Gazczar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 5 hotels in 10 days last February when prices were down and found them all good value. The Riverfront was the standout because of the staffs obvious enjoyment of working at this hotel and their job satisfaction somehow made me, my wife and I'm sure most guests stay just a little better than they had counted on. Pool excellent. Location good if you like working along the river for 15 minutes to Chinatown. Breakfast/service tops. The other hotels were Furama City (location slightly better but service not so good), Royal (no complaints but location was the pits), Concorde (great location, John the resident piano player was a highlight of our Singapore holiday), Bintan Lagoon Resort is special but avoid monsoon season. Gary Adams, Gooseberry Hill, Perth, Western Australia p.s try Ivory Indian restaurant at Clark Quay

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Cigarfreak
Reviews.Content: Looking at the reviews and coming across with both good and bad experiences, I came to realize that I was not the only one with such an opinion. This hotel was good and bad. On the good side, rooms were good sized and clean. Hotel was a bit cheaper compared to other 4/5 stars in Singapore. On the negative side, the hotel is a bit far from Orchard St and other attractions sites such as China Town and Santosa Island. Service is really bad. If this hotel was rated as three star and was a bit cheaper I'd say it was a good hotel. But because they claim to be 5 star and the rate is higher than 200 Singapore $ than I say it is a pretty average hotel, situated far from the city center. You will take so many cabs a day to go into town and come back that instead you would be better of staying at a hotel at Orchard St.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service & Bad Experience!”
Reviews.Author: cheetahgal4
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 3:30pm to check in for 3 rooms for my family. But we were told rooms were not yet ready and would be ready in an hour. OK then, we went out to get something to eat and came back at 5:30pm. DISAPPOINTINGLY, we were told only 2 rooms were ready for us. It is just totally unacceptable! They wasted me time to argue with them. And we could finally get access to our third room at 6:00pm. I travelled with my family, there are 3 kids and 2 elderly. Imagine that you just took hours of travel from Bintan and expected to check in to a hotel room for a shower and then go out to have a city tour. But they just kept letting us down. And the staff still didn't accept it's their fault and kept calling to my room trying to explain that it's not their fault. They were just wasting my time! There are so many choices in Singapore. Don't select this one. The hotel is actually quite dated. The toilet at the lobby is smelly and not clean.

Reviews.Title: “Problem after problem then tried ripping me off..”
Reviews.Author: stu.bec
Reviews.Content: First of all the location is ok, its not at the heart of where it's all happening but its a 15 min walk from the MRT. Nearby is a 7/11, a garage and about 15 mins away a mall. Upon check in all was good. The staff were excellent and it seemed no problame was too much. We went to our room which was absolutely fine, the bathroom is a bit small but we were happy. Then we left and i checked the door and it would not lock. Maintenance came up and said the door lock would need replacing. Eventually he decided we would have to be moved to another room. I got the call and was taken to another room, i walked in and was almost sick with the stale smell of cigarettes, additionally the room had only 2 beds when we had paid for 3. I went to the lobby and complained about the smell and beds and with absolute contempt i was given another room. Then i needed to print some documents, this can only be done via the internet room and none of the computers have Microsoft Office on, only the very basic word. At $2 a print its not cheap. Late check out is charged at $100 for 6hrs (even though its supposed to be 1/2 room rate and my room cost $120) then full rate for any more - Which is an absolute joke. Then the internet, it is an absolute joke, loads of sites i visited didnt work and kept having to be repeatedly refreshed. Anyway, the way it works is that you pay either 35cents per minute up to a maximum of $25 per 24hr period. Imagine my surprise when upon check out i was being charged $35 for the internet. Now, the woman who dealt with he did not have a single braincell. She was simply unable to understand that i had been in the hotel for 17hrs since i checked in (it was written in black and white on the charges bill) Internet costs a maximum of $25 for 24hrs - i couldn't possibly owe $38. She tried the whole "Its per day, so use it at night then in the morning is 2 separate 24 hr periods but i was having none of it. The manager came out and sorted it. The woman still looked perplexed as she angrily gave me my receipt. The short of it is that for the price there are many more hotels that offer a lot more and are a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fabrizio80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for three nights, it was adequate. Location was not that great because it was a little far from the closest subway stop. Breakfast was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dnkholiday
Reviews.Content: This is an very good hotel within a short walking distance of Clarke Quay (10-15 mins). Orchard Road best accessed by taxi or the bus stand in front of the Riverfront Hotel which was almost opposite. Hotel is very modern, clean and run efficiently. Room was very modern and easily the best of the four hotels we stayed in on our holiday. The front of hotel staff were exceptionally knowledgeable and helpful (especially the porters). Easy to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it a lot!”
Reviews.Author: xerobasher
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Singapore for a stopover so the hotel was dirt cheap for me to stay in. I got a room on a high floor, view was pretty nice. The room itself was roomy and clean, bathroom nice aswell. The location is a little bit tricky, but taxis are pretty inexpensive (compared to my home country), so it's not a big deal. Lobby was nice, bar aswell. Pool looked good, didn't use it though. Much, much better than the Orchard Parade where I stayed before for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Gloryfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in July 09. The room was adequate for me, small but well equipped and functional. All staff were friendly and efficient. I liked the bar/lounge area. A bit pricey, but happy hour is good value. The staff here in particular were charming. Good pool area. In a good location on Havelock Rd. Close walking distance to Robertson Quay and 10 minutes walk to Clarke Quay

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fine, but missed out on Last Minute Deal”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_OzAustralia
Reviews.Content: We found that the hotel was fine as advertised. The daily breakfast was nice as was the pool, however the hotel's location was a little out of the way as it was a 15min walk to the Metro Station. The one thing that we did miss out on was the last minute deals that were to be had using the hotel's website and other last minute hotel booking sites. I did mention this to the hotel and was able to get a free upgrade which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, average service, disastrous internet”
Reviews.Author: superstardj
Reviews.Content: Was buoyed when I checked into the Furama as my refurbished 19th floor club room was lovely - very modern and sleek, big flat-screen, etc. Not sure what the normal rooms are like but the room was great. There were a few other residual benefits to having a Club room, particularly the lovely lounge downstairs which offered free breakfast, which was fairly varied and very private. There's also a (free) evening drinks service there that I didn't get to check out. However, I had a few issues too. Service could be a little slapdash - half the time I dialed the 'at your service' line, it went to answerphone, slightly disappointing in a hotel of this apparent quality. Generally anything I requested was rather slow. The cleaning staff however were excellent, checking with me what time of day I wanted my room serviced, and doing a sterling job. My no.1 gripe is the internet - it's slow. And I mean seriously sloooow. It's also only wired, so forget sitting on your bed working, you're chained to the desk. My job unfortunately requires fast internet, so for the 3 days I was here, I didn't really get a lot done. Right now, I'm watching a download which hasn't been above 10k per second. It's rather like the old days of dial-up internet. This issue alone would be enough for me to return to my usual hotel, the Grand Copthorne, where the rooms are clearly not as nice, but the internet is at least useable. Here, it isn't. Shame, because the rooms really are great. If you don't need internet during your stay, not really an issue, but if you're here on business, until they fix this issue, you probably want to pick somewhere different.

Reviews.Title: “Generous with Free Upgrades”
Reviews.Author: live_to_travel21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is generous with free upgrades. Staff is also flexible in granting late checkout. All-in-all - very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Anthony06
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and couldn't recommend it highly enough. Service was top class from check in to cleanliness of rooms to service at the bar. The price of tea and drink was very expensive in the hotel alright but I will return if I am in Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tub”
Reviews.Author: captain1711
Reviews.Content: A great executive room with a super glass walled bathroom. Free internet is a big added plus. Good service and reasonably good food.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotle”
Reviews.Author: subahu
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel with good rooms compitative rates 167 usd incl breakfast for 3 adults in a room per day. Minus is too many group tours check in making the lobby noisy and crowded. has good restaurants pool & spa. The staff are courteous and helpful. The rooms are clean and well decorated so once inside you are comfortable. Near the city world mall 5 mins walking distance which has macdonalds burguer king and other restaurants and also a food court.Has lot of branded stores like british india charles & keith aldo body shop dorthy perkins. 20 min walk from china town a must see at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: irishkiwiPapamoa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel after endless searching for where to stay in Sinapore. The location is okay, not central but very close to Chinatown and if you are anyway inclined you can walk in to the centre ( we did numerous times) or to the tube. We got the hotel at a discounted rate , it is clearly a business hotel however our rooms were upgraded on checking in and we were very pleased with the comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Adequate Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: EZT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Furama Riverside for 2 nights. I had a deluxe room (upgraded courtesy of reception staff) which was very good. My package comprised internet access in the rate (and this is something you should better negotiate upfront as internet access is S$25 per day plus taxes otherwise). The lobby area is of high quality and so are the restaurants, coffee bars, and conference rooms. High standards. The room was very nice indeed although the bed was extremely hard. I have not ever complained about this in any other review and was a problem in that respect here. I won't generalise because I can't tell whether they had changed the mattress in that particular room. The toilette was perfectly adequate with sufficient room. Location is not the best in Singapore but it is still good. You will need a taxi to get to Orchard Rd or to do the business district. But there are both short taxi rides. You are very close to the riverside and there are plenty of restaurants in the area. Clarke Quay is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel (although you shouldn't walk this distance in the middle of the day due to the oppresive heat and humidity). I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great buffets!”
Reviews.Author: Angel84India
Reviews.Content: was staying at Furama for 2 weeks. the buffet spread is good and the service is also very timely. however, the laundry etc is over priced. also, they could do with cleaning up the place a little more. otherwise, the staff is very sweet. it is worth staying in when you are not looking at a expensive stay

Reviews.Title: “Executively superior”
Reviews.Author: mantal_loo
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel in singapore which provide a reasonable price. Having a look on fragrance and hotel 81 chain hotels, the price was quite unreasonable i guess ( they offered me SGD 99 for fragrance hotel in lavender), thus decided to look for another hotel. surfing the web, i bumped into furama riverfront hotel. I was suprised to see their price still looks cheap (only sgd 99 nett from agoda.com). i directly pay for it, and print out the purchase proof. When i arrived in the hotel lobby, I know that i was not going into a cheap hotel. well, the lobby looks exclusive and luxurious with those marble. the concierge man directly assist us to go into receptionist when we said we have booked the hotel. the receptionist request my passport, my friend id card, collateral (credit card), and ask whether prefer non smoking or smoking room. my friend prefer non smoking, and she then said "sir, we upgrade your room into executive room without any additional charge". whoala.. i have read from tripadvisors many people stayed in this hotel get an upgrade for free, but i still surprised when it happened.. we then went into our room and find this executive room to be more than expected ( we were expecting a superior room but executive room ). The executive room was very clean, modern touch with a big LCD tv, has complete lighting giving a warm ambience, the bathroom was only shower though (i expect to get bath tub and shower). no complaint whatsoever with the room. very convenient overall. final words : get into this hotel, do not expect for anything, who knows they will give you an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and good value”
Reviews.Author: Roamingx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before and didn't remember it being anything special, and I tried it again this time after getting an unbelievable two-night price on lastminute.com (which, by the way, I did not find on any other booking sites). It took forever for them to check me in but I guess it was worth the wait because they ended up needing to upgrade me to a suite due to availability issues. Everything worked well, the breakfast buffet was good (although for some odd reason there were no tropical fruits), there were tons of staff -- I never had to open the door or press the elevator button, good self-service laundry, easy taxi service, nice tropical waterfall setting off the bar. My only issue was some construction noise next to my room, which quickly stopped after I complained to the front desk. I stayed at four different hotels in one week in Singapore and this was the best and cheapest (then again I was in a suite while paying for a standard so that helped!)

Reviews.Title: “Just the hotel I was wanting”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideMurph
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what I wanted. Searching for Hotels in Singapore can be quite hard, as things are generally over priced, and there are a lot of mixed reviews on the web. But I really did get lucky. Upon arrival from the airport, the taxi fare was about 10 AUD, which was far less than I was expecting. I arrived quite late at night, and was really pleased with the service when I entered. I was upgraded to the higher level of room, which was pleasing and I was glad to be settled in to a room with a huge TV, huge bed, lovely bathroom and sizeable desk for which to lay out maps and clothes etc. If you are into exploring, as I am, then the location really is quite good. There are numerous ways to walk into the city itself, and I walked to Clarke Quay, Orchard Road and China town amongst on the mornings I was there with no problem at all. There is much to do nearby, just ask the staff, they were so happy to share with me the places that they visit, where they eat, and it was great to go and visit those places for breakfasts and quick trips around the Hotel. Plus, if you can't walk, Taxis are plentiful and cost around 5 AUD to get to Orchard Road. In fact it cost me just 17AUD to get to the Zoo. I really enjoyed my stay at the Furama, the staff treated me excellently, helping at all opportunities and joking about as I got to know them. Realistically, if you like some adventure, and don't mind going for some walks or asking people for some advice, this is a really great hotel to stay at. I think if you take yourself too seriously, and are in need of feeling like a King/Queen and seek opulence, then you need to rethink your price range in Singapore, as this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Princesssazzle
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel and thought it was great value for money. We got a good deal on the room (through the hotel's own website) as compared to similar offerings in Singapore. There was a wide choice of food for breakfast. The room was clean and we had a nice view. I think the room had recently been redone. The location is a bit out of the center but 1) there are always taxis in front (not the case in all parts of Singapore) and 2) there are regular buses which go to China Town and Orchard Road in 10 minutes. I recently stayed at the Furama China Town (it's sister hotel) which is more central and was really disappointed. It smelled horrible and the staff were not as friendly. Plus my room had just been redone, but really cheaply. The whole hotel felt a bit old.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: JKWD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and the two year old son. In spite of previous adverse comments on this site, we found this hotel quite pleasant. It is a bit aged but reasonably well maintained. We stayed at the tower wing on high floor overlooking the bush nearby which was nice. The room was of reasonable size and the service was ok. The buffet breakfast was good and the dinner buffet was also nice (a bit expnesive though). We took the Hippo hop on and hop off tour bus at the stop outside the adjacent Miramar hotel (1 minute walk from the hotel). We also took taxi to Clark Quay and the Orchard Road which was fast and cheap and we needed not take the hotel free shuttle (only twice in the monring). The pool was small but ok. Overall, the stay was quite pleasant and the hotel was truly 4 star +.

Reviews.Title: “I've been in better Youth Hostels”
Reviews.Author: travellerl
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 12:15 am, very tired after a long flight, room smelt musty and was definately not the superior room i though it was going to be, i've stayed at youth hostels in the 80's with better facilities. Location wise terrible, nothing around (specially for breakfast in the morning)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: grumblebums
Reviews.Content: We checked in rather early in the morning not expecting to get to our room straight away but were pleasantly surprised when told our room was ready and we were also been upgraded! This hotel is very good, pool is great, our room was large, very clean and pleasant. No real problems apart from the location been well away from MRT and also a fair walk to bus stops. The hotel shuttle bus only departs twice in the morning and if you don't book early enough you miss out! Taxi's in Singapore however are cheap and reliable so are a good alternative. The breakfast was very good but it did not vary from day to day which was a little disappointing. Overall great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: jogPerth
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with this hotel. Booked for a bargain price on Wotif.com and we were still upgraded from a superior to a deluxe room. The staff were friendly, polite and attentive and did everything they could to accommodate our toddler. The lobby was lovely, the room was freshly renovated and was very stylish and comfortable, breakfast was fantastic and the room service menu was, overall, very reasonably priced. The tour desk also offered a good range of tours at reasonable prices. Spending the morning sight-seeing, then returning to the hotel for a swim and room-service sandwiches by the pool (before a nap) was the perfect schedule for my 2-year-old and I. We were really happy with the location, too, as we enjoyed long walks along the river and to Chinatown, and it was only a short taxi-ride to Orchard Road and the Botanic Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but watch out for prices”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Furama Riverfront for two nights recently. There are some nice things about the hotel - for example, we really appreciated having access to a washer and dryer, which is pretty unusual for a somewhat upscale hotel like this. The staff was nice and let us check in a little early. The location is okay considering there is an MRT station 10 minutes away (walking) but there is not much of interest in the immediate surroundings unless you are interested in the karaoke club and extracurricular activities referenced in the review below. That really isn't a problem because of the excellent public transportation and cheap taxis in Singapore. We did feel pretty nickled and dimed by the hotel. The first day we went to the hotel's Indonesian restaurant. We wouldn't have gone there except we were hungry and there weren't any nice restaurants within walking distance and I was curious about Indonesian food. The food was delicious and the staff were really nice, but two entrees and two non-alcoholic drinks cost US$70! For lunch!! I don't pay anywhere near that in San Francisco, an expensive city, even at a nice restaurant. I almost had a heart attack when I saw the bill. To be fair, they tried to get us to order the buffet but we weren't very hungry. That would have been somewhat cheaper, but still pretty expensive. The other thing was that the exchange rate the front desk gave us when we changed money was outrageous. We got $1.46 at the airport but the hotel only gave us $1.27. I expect them to make a profit, but come on!! I didn't remember Singapore being this expensive when we went a few years back and I am thinking it is only at this hotel that we have experienced this sort of thing, because we went on tours and had other meals and went to clubs and didn't have that same feeling of being ripped off. If you get a reasonable price for the hotel room and avoid the restaurants and other hotel services, it is fine to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: pungpui
Reviews.Content: We needed a cheap hotel to stay in overnight in Singapore between a cruise and a flight to Hong Kong, so we chose this hotel with the Singapore Stopover package (offered by Singapore Airlines). We had stayed in this hotel before in 2004 with the same package, and found it to be quite OK. This time around – what on earth happened here!? In 2004, we stayed in the ‘Tropical Wing’, while this time we stayed in the main tower. What a difference! Check in was quite efficient and we were issued with room card immediately (before the official check-in time). After spending a few hours on Orchard Road, we returned to our 2 rooms (interconnecting, non-smoking). The corridor has a permanent damp smell (how can this be? This is Singapore! Not London!). The room was nearly as bare as a youth hostel. Virtually a table, a chair and the most bare looking, low beds I’ve ever seen. They were just too hard (like they’ve been slept on for 20 years – probably doesn’t help that a very seedy looking karaoke club is right next door within the building!) and the pillows gave me a headache that night trying to sleep on them. Toilet was OK, but only just! At least it was clean without traces of hair (as I would have expected looking at the rest of the room). As I said before the hotel shares the block with a very seedy karaoke bar where you see lots of girls in short skirts downstairs at around 9pm. Apparently this is an upscale area for hookers (lower paid ones stay around Gey Lang), which explains why all these men come out of expensive cars as I saw looking out of the window. For Singapore Airlines stopover guests, the hop on bus stop is just conveniently around the corner, and Zion food markets is a short 5 minute walk away as well as some restaurants also 5 minutes away in another direction (ask the concierge). Orchard Road by taxi is probably at most 10 minutes away so relatively cheap to get to, while Vivo City and the cruise centre (for Star Cruises) is also about 10 minutes by taxi away in the south direction. So locationwise it appears to be quite OK if you ignore the seedy club. I didn’t hear much music as expected from that place – so either the rooms have very good noise insulation or there isn’t much dancing and singing going on down there if you know what I mean! The lobby also has a tours desk so you can approach them to ask about day tours around Singapore. Note the Singapore Airlines stopover food discount only applies to A la Carte at the Square Restaurant, not the buffet, while the cafe downstairs offers coffee for a whopping $SG12 per glass! What a rip off! At least it was cheaper than other Singapore hotels and one night is OK – anymore than one night I would probably chose somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jwyh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights 11th - 14th December, 2008. We booked it through wotif mystery deal and it cost $150SGD a night. The room was quite average and the bathroom was small. But for the price we paid, it was fine because accommodation is usually so expensive in Singapore. We used the gym and pool a few times. One night there was a wedding going on in the function room overlooking the pool. Location - didn't really have any issues with it... It isn't too close to MRT, but its only a 15 minute walk to Outram station. Not far at all! My major complaint would be the staff. Sometimes they were nice and accommodating, other times they would barely look at you. The worst was when we were waiting for a taxi outside the hotel to send a friend home. We waited 45 minutes. Now that wasn't the issue. The issue was the concierge staff were huddled around the front of the hotel, 4 of them talking to themselves. There were about 10 people waiting in line for a taxi, with 4 concierge staff doing nothing at all to accommodate the customers. After vetting our frustration, they finally decided they might try and get a taxi. My boyfriend asked to speak to the general manager. The concierge went to get duty manager, who apologised profusely. We asked for the name of the general manager, she gave an incorrect name. We asked to get his email, and she said she would call us in the morning which she never did. In the morning, a man came to apologise and gave us a signed letter from the staff, as well as a portable mobile phone charger. It was disappointing.. my boyfriend had stayed there once before and thoroughly enjoyed his stay. He made friends with the staff. This time, those friends weren't there anymore and the concierge staff did not know how to do their job. We probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: mela1963
Reviews.Content: This hotel actually exceeded my expectations expecting it to be a 3 star hotel. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and well maintained. Staff friendly. Only stayed for 1 night prior to our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Spam_Grievance
Reviews.Content: I like the Furama Riverfront alot. All of the service people were very friendly, and said hello and talked even if I didn't have a use for their services. Stayed on the executive floor. Nice room, and special breakfast. Very good. A little bit of a walk to the metro, which I don't mind since I like to walk alot anyway. They do have a shuttle to Orchard and Chinatown, but I could walk to those places anyway. Good Indonesian buffet, if a bit expensive, but worth the experience. Nice waterfall bar area. All in all, I was very pleased with my choice of this hotel. Taxis are very cheap, which was a surprise. Cool four story nightclub next door, so you can dance and drink off your jet lag, and mini marts and groceries close also.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BlueHeeler777
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over a weekend on a business trip. It is a little far from any MRT stations so one needs a taxi to get around. I was given a smoking floor but the smell was not too bad. Hotel was nice and clean, including the bathrooms, and I could not fault the attention and service of the staff. Breakfast was included and it was excellent with a huge range. Overall, the hotel was very good and I would stay again, although it seems expensive for what you get. This is due to the fact that Singapore is becoming such an expensive place to stay. It's such a shame. Hotel prices have doubled in the last 12 months or so and it is getting much cheaper to find accommodation elsewhere in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “lovely in non smoking”
Reviews.Author: TripperH
Reviews.Content: The staff were outstanding. Our room was very nice, on the return journey we got put in a smoking room, but when asked to be changed were so without any hassles. Enjoyed the restuarant and the shops in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Again! Furama excels again!”
Reviews.Author: MaverickRoss
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Furama in January at the end of our 8 week European holiday before returning to Australia. We had previously stayed at Furama three years earlier and the hotel is still quite a good choice. Check in was fast and efficient, we were very 'lucky' that they had actually oversold our Standard Superior rooms and so upgraded us to a suite. This was a lovely treat and a wonderful gesture. The room was clean and in very fine condition. Can't fault the staff for friendliness and professionalism - I tried to leave a small tip for the maid to thank her for doing a wonderful job and not only did she not take the tip but on returning to our room she had left us some complimentary chocolates. Location: At first glance the hotel seems like it is away from anywhere, but in reality its actually in the middle of many of Singapore's key attractions. Its only about a 15min walk or $3 cab ride away from Chinatown, and their is always a surplus of Taxi's out the front, so its sometimes much easier just to get in and pay the $3. Also we ate at Clarke Quay one night and had a very leasurely 15min walk back to the hotel which was quite pleasent. The hotel offers a shuttle bus to Orchard road and Chinatown during the day, you just ring down the night before and put your name on the list - it stops at a couple of hotels so sometimes gets busy, but we never had any issues getting a seat. We are going back to Singapore in November and will be sure to stay at Furama again. Well worth a look and not too bad value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneVincent
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Furama. The hotel was lovely. We were upgraded upon arrival and were suprised by a card in our room signed by all the staff wishing us a happy honeymoon! Good gym and pool. Only about a 15 minute walk from China town.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mikkol
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel from company booking and stayed for 5 days. Overall the feeling isn't too bad - you have bellboy helping you pick up and take your luggage; the reception desk was welcoming. The room was huge as expected in Singapore standard. Everything seems fine except when I opened the closet a very stingy old wood smell just rushed to my nose. Sorry but I really can't bear the smell. As I don't use it often (only for the safe) I don't bother changing the room, but at this rate (I paid SGD200 or so) it shouldn't be that bad. Food-wise the given breakfast (not the superior side one) cannot be considered as good. The choices were limited. Nothing was really fresh (I had some cold cut 1st day and it smelled weird/bad so I didn't try anymore). Since then I only limited myself to fruit and bacon. If you really don't like the food there, you still have a choice - there's a nearby food center called Zion Riverside Food Centre which serves many local food nice and cheap. It only takes 10 min. to walk there. Location-wise yes in fact it's not convenient if you rely on subways (MRT) more often so taxis is prob. the only options around because there are no stations around. And the only major complaint I have is the reception lady. I cannot make any 800-number call to use my phone card. I tried to tell her to help around but she just thought I was dumb and didn't press the buttons right. So she helped me make the call. But I had many calls to make so she was feeling disturbed w/ all the requests. I asked her to ask somebody to come up to "fix" it but she just ignored. I didn't have time to write down the complaint when checking out but I don't think any receptionist should act that bad to customers.

Reviews.Title: “location not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: littlewomen4
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews we were concerned about the location of this hotel. But we neednt have worried..it's within walking distance of a 5 year old to Clarke and Boat Quays. And it's a pleasant walk, yes you have to cross a busy road, but there are pedestrian lights at the traffic lights. If you enjoy chinese food, there is a row of eating houses across the road behind the hotel - catering for locals so the prices are good. There were always taxis waiting outside the hotel so we never had to call for one, or wait. And then of course, there's the shuttle bus, make sure to ring reception the night before if you want to use it. And the hop-on-hop-off bus stops nearby - great to orientate yourselft with the city. We were travelling with 3 children and found the hotel perfect - we had adjoining rooms that were clean, odor-free and comfortable. The pool was fab for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: JandJ001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Furama Riverfront at the beginning and end of our European trip - 3 nights in total. We were booked into a superior room, which provided a good size bedroom and bathroom. The Furama is a modern and very attractive hotel and has 2 restaurants, internet room, bar/lounge, hotel shop. We dined in the restaurant for breakfast, the buffet breakfast was quite extensive and varied in the type of foods offered. We also had dinner one night in the same restaurant, which was also a buffet, probably not as exciting. When staying at the Furama on our return journey heading home to Australia, we went to the Indonesian restaurant in the hotel, which was absolutely fabulous food and the staff were so nice. The Furama was not as centrally located as some hotels and no where near the river!!!, however Orchard Road (the main shopping area), was only 5 minutes away by taxi, the hotel provided a shuttle bus to the shopping area or the bus stop was only 100 metres from the hotel. The staff at the Furama were very friendly and helpful. The only disappointment was on our return trip heading home, when after travelling over 12 hours from London and very tired, we arrived at the hotel to find our room was not ready. Whilst we could accept this and were asked to wait in the lounge area for an hour, when checking back with the reception staff after an hour, we were then told that the room had been cleaned, but still had to be inspected. After voicing our disapproval with the delay, the duty manager overhearing the conversation, intervened and we were allocated a room immediately. Despite the room being in the smoking area of the hotel, it was comfortable and clean. Would definitely stay at the Furama again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: debbz64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a week in this hotel. We were on the 9th floor and never had problems with the lifts. Not much of a view - Apartments and Greenery - Actually; not sure why they called it Riverfront because it certainly isn't on the riverfront. Nevertheless, the room and service was great. Robes, slippers and tea/coffee. The only thing we missed was an alarm clock. I guess just about everyone has one on their mobile phones. Half hour walk to orchard Rd, and 20 min walk to Clarke Quay Mrt. All around it is a lovely hotel but wouldn't stay here again as it was to far away from everything, although there is a free shuttle to Orchard Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: blackcherrypie
Reviews.Content: I was perfectly happy with this hotel. My partner and I stayed one night, on a stopover from UK to Australia, and it was just what we needed. Comfortable bed, large, clean, quiet room (although the decor was slightly dated) and clean, spacious bathroom, and very helpful, friendly staff. We had a great view from our room. As non-smokers, we would have preferred a non-smoking room, but when we arrived were told there would be a wait for one to be ready (it was only 8am so this was not unreasonable). Having been on a long flight and up for almost 24 hours, we took the smoking room as we just wanted a rest. This turned out to be a good call as I believe the non-smoking rooms are in a different part of the hotel and perhaps lack the views. Yes there was a slight smell of stale smoke at first, but this soon vanished into the air conditioning. The hotel is not centrally located, but the two attractions we were interested in were the Zoo and the Botanic Gardens, and the hotel is actually in a good position for reaching both of these on public transport. Also, as many other reviewers have said, taxis in Singapore are incredibly cheap and so the whole city is very accessible in this way. We didn't eat at the restaurant in the hotel as some of the other reviews on tripadvisor were not too good, and it seemed expensive. All in all, we had a good stay at the Furama Riverfront in Singapore and would certainly consider staying at this hotel on a stopover again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent short stay”
Reviews.Author: kittytravelz
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed our stay, the room was lovely and the views of the pool and city were amazing ! the entertainment was interesting and certainly gave us a few smiles, the champagne may have helped this slightly! the square restaurant has excellent food although some dishes arent for the light hearted! taxis are so cheap so and everything is really close so this is definately the best way to see this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Beer appetite champagne budget”
Reviews.Author: okie_mobro
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the executive floor in one of the newly remodeled rooms. The bathroom walls are made of glass. Very exotic on the architect’s computer until you need privacy and have a guest. There is supposed to be a shade for one wall of the bathroom. It was missing in my room. I told the staff about it the first day but it was never installed. There is not a clock in the room. There is no storage, everything is in the open, no wardrobe/closet or drawers to put your clothes in. Like a budget Motel 6 in America except with fine marble and fancy fixtures. The executive lounge with light dinner and free drinks was a great value. Attentive staff everywhere in the hotel. (except for shade maintenance I guess).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WRGMontreal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not on any river. With new owners in 2007 the hotel is slowly being upgraded. The hotel is within walking distance of Boat Quay but you do cross a busy road. My room on the executive level had an all glass walled bathroom and was very modern. However, that also meant little storage space for clothes. The staff very very courteous and attentive. I arrived with an incorrect reservation and while it took some sorting out the manager at the desk personally escorted me to my room. The doormen were also especilly courteous and helpful. The food at the restaurants was exellent. The staff in the executive lounge were very attentive and the breakfast and evening food was excellent. I consider the prices normal for Singapore and anyone who complains about the prices has forgotten that Singapore is a very expensive city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Szeling1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 3 different hotels in Singapore on my visit, including a 5 star hotel, and thought this was by far the best. The location isn't great - you need to get a taxi to go anywhere interesting - and it isn't riverfront but otherwise found it good value. Services like internet and room service weren't badly priced, the rooms were well kept and a good size, bathrooms also good. The staff were very friendly and helpful and went out of their way to find me the kind of room I wanted. Best of all was the pool which was big enough to do laps in and always clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: ryu1974
Reviews.Content: My room smelled like a stable and the air conditioner fan emitted a loud squeal all night. breakfast was pretty ordinary. At least the beds were comfortable and the room was clean, well I couldn't locate the source of the stable smells.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Shanda66
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, friendly staff and good facilities. Had a shocking pedicure in the spa on the ground floor but otherwise good experience

Reviews.Title: “Good area, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kuiken
Reviews.Content: A nice area in Singapore, as well a nice hotel. Well kept room and bathroom. Coffee and tea-making facilities. I had a nice view on the swimmingpool as a nice city-view. Problem was the my keycard for the room. Several times it did not work. Frontdesk was helpfull and polite. For security reasons the concierge walked with me to my room.
