And that's good, cause everyone can say that his door can't open. Good service. Although when you are standing in front of your door it should be opened. Made 1 reservation for the Night Safari in the Singapore Zoo via the concierge. Very helpful, as the reservation for the high-tea at the Raffles.Concierge gave good information and did what he promissed. Swimmingpool view was nice. The doorman in front of the hotel: a good host for the guest. Very nice, and made you feel welcome. Room good, area good, service good: In short a pleasant stay at the Furama Riverfront. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave056
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Furama Riverfront Hotel Singapore for 10 days, I found the hotel to be very clean and the staff extremely friendly especially the concierge who treated guests as friends , the only downside was that the evening meals were not very warm or appetising , but all in all I enjoyed my stay and would go back there again .

Reviews.Title: “Average!”
Reviews.Author: ssimmonds
Reviews.Content: The Furama is a perfectly adequate place to stay, although the decor is a little tired, it's just that there are better deals to be had in Singapore. The concierge and bell-boys were extremely helpful and friendly, although the desk staff less so. If you are there on business, beware of inflated prices for simple admin - I was quoted $2 per page to print out a work document. Other reviewers are correct, it's not particularly near anything, but then neither are a lot of other hotels and taxis are cheap and plentiful in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services from concierge”
Reviews.Author: jyjj
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in Furama riverfront hotel. I can't find any fault in this hotel. Concierge was great. They were smiling all the time and always willing to help you. Front desk services was excellent. and the room was spacious and clean. There was complimentary bus services from hotel to Orchard Road area. ( you have to book through Concierge and limited service) Also normal bus stop and SIA Hop on bus is a few steps from the hotel, take 5 minutes walk. Taxi fare was cheap so you don't have to worry even when you go out at night. My experience here was great. If I'm going back to Singapore, I'll definitely stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK; Location is Not!”
Reviews.Author: sandiegobill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Furama Riverfront for 4 nights in January 2008 as part of a Singapore Airline Stopover Holiday. They upgraded our room, which turned out to be large, functional, quiet and comfortable. The buffet breakfast (which cost extra) was expensive even with the 50% discount offered with the Singapore Stopover Holiday package—about $US18 after discount—and not all that good. They have in-room Ethernet, which was fast, but expensive. The major problem with this hotel is its location, a 10-15 minute walk to restaurants or anything of interest. The free Singapore Stopover Holiday bus was not helpful because from the Furama it takes about an hour to get to anything interesting. There are many comparably-priced hotels in Singapore that are more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndigoNorfolkEngland
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night as a stopover, the hotel/room was clean & nice. The food in the buffet resturant was OK but a limited choice in the evening. Took a while to be acknowledged by the staff on the front desk in the buffet resturant both at breakfast and evening meal but apart from that the service was good. The Bell boys were extremely friendly & helpful. No sign of a river though! About a 15 minute walk to Clarke Quey & China town. Botanical gardens were a short taxi drive away and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “awful!!”
Reviews.Author: kakkles
Reviews.Content: terrible- took 4 days to fix the shower (after complaining more times than can remember), door keys were faulty, jacuzzi wasnt a jacuzzi, got put into another wing that we didnt book, overcharged at the bar, food was generally always cold, didnt feel welcome, english wasnt great, staff would rather chat to others than guests. the bell boys/concierge were the only ones to notice you. would NEVER stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The Riverfront is badly maintained, no food selection and isisolated!”
Reviews.Author: JaditeDS7
Reviews.Content: Having specified to Singapore Airlines that I want a clean. centrally located hotel because of my disability we were shocked to be dumped into the Furama with it's chipped bath, broken basin, filthy curtains and beside our room an alcove clogged with dumped furniture and dirty mattresses. The only available food was from room service. Because I am disabled the fact that we had to take a 15 minute taxi ride to to find a restaurant was particularly difficult. Even a faxed complaint to the CEO of Singapore Airlines was ignored. Nice City, shame about the 3rd world conditions provided by the Airline. David @ Mal

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jakmusic
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights in the Executive Suite as this was the only room that could accommodate 2 adults and 2 children (6 & 9 years old). We booked through the hotel's website which provided a great internet rate. Our 9 year old had a rollaway, while our 6 year old slept in our King sized bed. The Executive Suite had a separate lounge room with a TV, and a very spacious bathroom. The space was great for the kids. We had breakfast everyday in The Square restaurant, which had a great buffet. We also had access to the Executive Lounge for breakfast and evening cocktails. We never had breakfast there, because there wasn't much to choose from, but the evening cocktails was nice to have just before heading out for dinner. The staff were very friendly, especially the doormen. The only complaints we had was that the bed was very hard, and the shower was very erratic - would sometimes be really cold or really hot. Other than that, we had a great stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Gjlpfa
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at this hotel in November for 3 nights. We asked for 2 rooms with an interconnecting door and this wasn't a problem. The Hotel is about a 20min walk from Orchard Road but the taxis in Singapore are great and cheap so this wasn't a problem either. The Hotel staff were very helpful. The Buffet Breakfast excellent. Internet is available in the rooms for a reasonable fee. A Great Place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay (Executive Room)”
Reviews.Author: calfred
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Executive Room with my gf on New Year's Eve. I booked through the hotel website and got a bargain rate of just S$280 (inclusive of taxes). This included a breakfast for 2 and the exclusive access to the Executive Lounge. Service was excellent. Breakfast was alright with a decent spread. The pool with a jacuzzi was also very nice especially at night. Only downside was that its location, which is not very accessible. Will definitely be willing to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: Viminalis
Reviews.Content: To break the long haul from Australia to Europe we've fallen in the habit of having a one night stopover in one of the Asian hubs. Of importance is a quiet room, a shower and a comfortable bed. The Furama Waterfront amply met these basic requirements. It is an anonymous, unexciting Asian hotel but quite meets the travellers' needs. The room was quiet, spacious and well appointed. The staff were freindly and helpful. It is a bit formulaic and if things don't go to script it can be interesting. We had a single voucher to cover the Furama on the way out and the Copthorne hotel on the return. The Furama wanted to take our single voucher and give us a photocopy to be used with the Copthorne later on. We declined this offer and said we'd hang on to the voucher and that they could take a photocopy.The Reception staff found this a bit hard to deal with but we got our way but we did feel that we were auditioning for parts in an Asian Fawlty Towers sketch. For a stopover the hotel was good and would be fine for a Singapore holiday, however it is a bit distant from the main shopping areas so if this is important, you might want to find another hotel. Taxis are cheap however and location shouldn't be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not Riverfront!”
Reviews.Author: Ruby067
Reviews.Content: The first thing to mention, which soon becomes obvious on arrival, is that this hotel is definitely NOT a riverfront hotel! It is in fact about 150 metres from the river, across a very wide, busy road. Reception staff were rather cold, in contrast to the porters, who were very friendly and welcoming. Our room was large, but seemed rather 'hard' looking - a bit dated perhaps. Buffet breakfast offered an enormous selection of hot and cold dishes, with excellent staff to keep tables cleared and food well stocked up. The open air swimming pool was a definite asset, and was well maintained, as were the changing facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly unhappy at the time, better in hindsight”
Reviews.Author: xjesusx
Reviews.Content: Okay, so at the time we stayed in the Furama City Centre I wasn't completely satified with all aspects of the room, however as time passes my memory is holding onto more of the positive aspects of our stay. I stayed with my girlfriend for three days, and we had a great time in Singapore. The location of this hotel is good, right in the middle everything with easy access to wherever you may wish to explore...walking distance from Orchard Road. There is a nice swimming pool and restaurants/bars within the hotel itself, and a supermarket nearby. Of the room itself, I had a few complaints - the bathroom was leaning toward antiquated, perhaps a renovation in the next year or two wouldn't go astray...the toilet was slowly but constantly creating a river between the bottom of the bowl and the drain in the middle of the floor. However there was a shower and a bath, which was good. TV and other facilities (most importantly a personal safe in the room) were provided and appreciated. The room was nice and clean. On the second day we returned to our room to find new items in the minibar, which caused us to question the help desk whether we would be charged as we had not consumed anything from the minibar. They said that we were to be charged, but soon cancelled the charge when we explained. Overall the staff were very friendly, and the food in the asian style restaurant was good. I think overall the hotel did represent excellent value for money, and we were in the end quite happy with our stay. Oh, and the little lady who runs the general shop in the lobby is lovely, very helpful and friendly, with good prices on the items.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: aus11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Furama Riverfront, but dont be fooled its not really anywhere near the river haha! Check in was very smooth and staff were friendly. We had a nice room, quite big in size with a nice bathroom and mirrors everywhere. The one thing i didnt like about the room was the bed, im not usually fussy about matresses but i had such a sore back after sleeping on these beds, they are very uncomfortable, but for me it wasnt a huge issue just something i noticed. And also the location of our room was right near these big machines that had fans that spun water around, i have no idea what they were for, but they were rather loud and annoying, if we had of been staying longer than the 5 nights we would have asked to be moved. But apart from that no complaints. Breakfast was nice, lots to choose from and they never seemed to be too busy in there, i think its a very good sized hotel. Restaraunt staff were all very friendly and helpful. We also had dinner at the same place you go for breakfast, i cant remember the name of it.... but we had the buffet and it was great! Really nice food, and soo many desserts, i had a hard time deciding and walked out feeling very full! Hotels location isnt exactly central, its not too far away from anything (by taxi anyway) bur its not that close to anything either.... Although one day we just went for a walk around the streets around the hotel and there is pretty much nothing there, not even a seven eleven to buy a drink from. Overall i did enjoy my stay at the Furama and i would recommed it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Furama Riverfront”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi033
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a two day stopover in September, and a one night stopover in October. We enjoyed our time here. Our twin room was well appointed and clean with comfortable beds and a lovely bathroom. There were tea making facililties and a room safe. The staff, especially the conceriege and his staff were helpful and pleasant to us and were very polite. The reception staff were efficient and helpful. Room service for breakfast was efficient but quite expensive. The only down point was the sheer volume of the live entertainment in the lounge in the evenings. We would recommend this hotel to travellers, and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: EmmaandJohann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a 3 night stop over and found it to be great value for money. We booked via hotels.com and got breakfast included in the price of £240. We were impressed with the hotel - it was luxurious and huge with excellent facilities. The room was fine and the breakfast buffet was extensive in choice - I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a value for money stop over. I agree the hotel is located slightly away from the main attractions, but there is a bus stop within a 3 minute walk where you can pick up the Sightseeing buses and it is within easy walking distance (15 mins) to the Riverfront which is a fantastic place to spend an evening with lots of resturants, bars and shops. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “bad experiance”
Reviews.Author: emmabrown
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel in march whenever we entered the musty stale smell was apparent even in our so called deluxe room i would not recommend this hotel to anyone the breakfast was like a cattle market and of poor quality not a nice experiance we had previously been to bangkok and our accomodation there was less grade but was so much more luxurious the staff at the furama are not very helpful and think that kuoni should not use this hotel i was glad to leave and get to the maldives emma brown

Reviews.Title: “two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimpsonsCapeTown
Reviews.Content: my husband andi stayed at this hotel with our two kids aged seven and one years old.this has been our .this has been our sixth trip to singapore but our first time in this hotel.we booked via our travel agent and payed 236 us dollars for a deluxe room.on arriving at the hotel we were placed in a room the size of a jail cell.the carpets were filthy and worn and the bed looked as if would fall apart at any moment.the smell in the room was overbearingly mouldy .i felt disgusted that they called this a deluxe room.the receptionist insisted this was a deluxe room and did not seem perturbed by my horror.after much argument and my causing a scene in the lobby did she find another deluxe room which i was forced to accept as i could not get my money back.this room was slightly better but i would never return to this filthy,smelly hotel and there surly staff.forget about breakfast it is very poor quality.i previously stayed at copthorne hotel next door and would return there.you have been warned!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: thegoderic
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in the hotel for a series of business meetings. I've stayed at better places. Reception always seemed to be busy & I had to wait 10 minutes to get checked in. Had an exec level room that was fine, although the glass-fronted bathroom may not be to everyone's tastes. Exec lounge was average at best, poor compared to other Singapore hotels that I know such as the Conrad. Other areas just suggested that the hotel didn't quite come up to scratch. For example the toilets in the conference level stank all week, there was no air conditioning in the elevators and the refreshments in the conference room consisted of open jugs of tap water, rather than the bottles you would expect to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover choice”
Reviews.Author: Reen12
Reviews.Content: Booked it via Singapore Stopover holidays. Excellent value for money. Going back this year. Happy with the hotel in all aspects. Rooms 5 Service 5 Value 5 Cleanliness 5 Dining 5 Location is a bit away from the main attractions but there are buses close by Would stay here again and again

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough!”
Reviews.Author: karching
Reviews.Content: I don't have anything bad to say about this hotel. We were placed in the older wing of the building and although it wasn't the best hotel we have stayed in in Singapore it did have a really large bed, fabulous bathroom with bath and all the amenities required. The breakfast was a bit of a rip off but I think that is stock standard in Singapore hotels. Our room didnt have a great view and I did upgrade as well. Whether that was an upgrade...I don't know? What is fabulous was it was right near Chinatown, walking distance so this was a real plus and their bar area looked stunning with a waterfall feature etc. If having to stay in this hotel again I probably would ask to be put in the tropical wing as that I believe is the newer side and I think it would be nicer. But it provided everything needed, the staff were very helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but lacking the finishing touches”
Reviews.Author: NZTourists
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel as part of a free Singapore holiday stopover June 29-30. We arrived early after a long flight from Paris, and appreciated the staff giving us a very early check in. The hotel entrance and lobby are very impressive, so we were expecting more from our room. It was spacious and had tea & coffee making facilities, and had airconditioning. However, the decor was outdated, the toilet seat was broken, and the room smelt musty. The hotel is not right on the riverfront, but the river is just across the road, and makes for a pleasant stroll at night. Overall, an adequate hotel, but not one to generate fond memories (unlike a couple of hotels we enjoyed in Europe).

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for the City”
Reviews.Author: Rawsy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Furama at the end of June 2007 as part of our honeymoon package with Kuoni. The hotel is a good sizewith all the amenities you need for a city break, We stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed our stay. We stayed in a superior room on the 15th floor. The room was spacious and well conditioned in the very humid Singapore. The hotel istelf has a great pool and a good bar which has live music each night. They have a hotel bus which takes you to China town and the nearby Clarkes Quay as well as Orchard Road shopping area. Both are worth a visit. The hotel is slightly out of the way for any public transport other than taxis. On that note be very careful with taxis. My advice is to get the price agreed first as we got a bit ripped off on the first night. Not knowing the price the driver charged us more than what it should be!!! There is a nightclub next door but there was no noise from there whatsoever. As another cautious note someone tried to put a meal on our room which showed up on checking out. After much deliberation the staff sorted it. despite the fact we showed them our passport signatures which were totally different than the tosser who got the meal!! Overall a good hotel which although is not in the heart of the city is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good reasonably priced accommodation”
Reviews.Author: ReefCanberra
Reviews.Content: Courteous staff. Room clean and comfortable. Arrived early but took a couple of hours before room could be allocated. A bit on the edge but cheap taxi fares keep destinations like Chinatown and Orchid Road within easy and quick access. Eating locations didn't appear to be within easy walking distance outside hotel - important as, typically for Singapore, charges for food and beverages inside hotel quite high

Reviews.Title: “OK in the Tropical Wing”
Reviews.Author: VTpikey
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 1am. My room on the 10th floor of the tower smelt stale. Tried to change rooms but the hotel was full. The bathtub took forever to drain after a shower and the toilet cistern didn’t shut off after flushing. Managed to change rooms the following day. The Tropical wing was less Spartan and quieter than the tower, and all the plumbing worked OK! Breakfast in the restaurant was poor for $S30. Instead try The Book Cafe at 20 Martin Rd - open at 8:30 am (see this place mark in Google Earth http://bbs.keyhole.com/ubb/showthreaded.php?Cat=0&Board=EarthTravel&Number=914816) or various places in Great World City - 10 min walk up Kim Seng Rd. Internet cost S$40 for 24 hours (used time not clock time). Connection poor though - even with a wired connection it took 8 minutes to download a 10.6 Mb file. The web browser also opening an extra window to the CNN home page.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, they've tried!”
Reviews.Author: travelDIY
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights through a package with Singapore Airline. Not having much expectation after reading the reviews in TA, but it turned out to be a little better than expected. Upon arrived the hotel at 9 in the morning, it is of course too early to check-in, but the hotel staff tried their best to find a room for us. We ended up waiting for about 45 mins and received a free upgrade to the executive floor. The room is not very spacious but adequate. It has been renovated recently. The bed, coat rack, and the bathroom all looked kind of new. I am quite pleased with that, at least it looks pretty clean to me. The hotel counter staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful, they may not look like so due to lack of smiles but they are very responsive to my inquiries. The downside of this hotel is the location, it is a bit isolated from everywhere else. It is not within walking distance to any MRT station. Although the concierge told us Chinatown is 10 mins away, it is not quite achievable walking in this steamy weather. We always take the taxi. Breakfast is included but the selection is limited and the quality is very so so, I'd prefer to eat at any food court or local cafe if you are going out anyway. While waiting for our friends to meet up for dinner, we went for a drink at the bar with a view of a waterfall in the garden. The atmosphere is quite nice except there was a live band with 3 girls singing and dancing which makes the bar a little like a 1-star nightclub. I suggest they should find someone playing piano instead. Overall speaking, the hotel is adequate and seems clean. The helpful staff make our stay more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donDoha
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a week in April. Good hotel. Large rooms. Concierge was great in terms of pointing out places to go, shop and eat. Great mall with grocery store about 2 blocks away (it had everything else in it too but I wasn't shopping). Good hookup for tours of the city. Bar had fantasitic waterfall outside. Very friendly and helpful staff in bar and hotel. Restaraunts good but reasonable restaurants close as well.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ECAus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night in April. The standard room was comfortable and quiet roomy. Its location is not within walking distance to any MRT station. We needed to catch taxi in and out. A few restaurants by the riverfront are however within the walking distance. A night club is next door. Though it's not for me, it does not disturb my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, First Class, Definetley recommend”
Reviews.Author: jhaig
Reviews.Content: This hotel was superb, stopped off for a 2 night break enroute to Melbourne with our 2 daughters who are 12 and 4, the concierge were fantastic with the kids. Hotel really was sparkling clean inside, had booked 2 seperate rooms but the staff when they saw we had a young child changed our rooms to interconnecting rooms, rooms were very spacious and extremley clean. The hotel is a taxi ride away from Orchard Road but the taxis are so cheap. Entertainment was in place in the bar area the evenings we were there. Staff were wonderful with us and the children, would definetley go back to this hotel, would say it was more a 5 star than 4 star. Top marks from us!!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms with even numbers”
Reviews.Author: beaverwillows
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are very small in the family suite (even number rooms). We were put in a horrible smoking room on the 9th floor to start with - even after I had phoned the hotel to make sure that we had a Non-smoking room. After we complained they moved us to a room on the 13th floor (1315,1317) These rooms were quite nice except the airconditioning unit is outside the window and makes a very loud noise. We then had a nice stay and the pool area at the hotel is one of the best I have seen is Singapore - pool is huge and nice spa attached. Service was great and the foyer staff excellant. We then returned 10 days later and once again given horrible little rooms (1202 1204) for 6 people. These even number rooms are just way to small for a family of 6 compared to the odd number rooms.They state in the brouchure Family suite in Tower wing.... well all it is, is two rooms adjoining and that is it.... I loved the pool here and would tell families to stay just for the pool area, but make sure you get odd number rooms in the tower wing on the non-smoking floors otherwise you will be very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms+Excellent Service+Excellent location=Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmmmja
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel after a very long flight the hotel staff notified us that our stay had been booked for August instead of September! It could have turned out bad but the hotel staff organised everything and we were even upgraded to the 18th floor! It was one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in! With very very large beds, great views, huge TV, a safe and very clean bathroom. They also had a shuttle bus into orchard road and China town for free. The breakfast was nice, very large buffet slection and a little expensive when you have a family. We would highly reccomend this hotel and will be staying here again for sure
